ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS

block.text: HӘVARİLӘRİN İŞLӘRİ

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 1
Dear Theophilus, in my first book, I told all that Jesus did and taught from the beginning

block.text: Ey Teofil, birinci yazılarım İsanın göyә qaldırıldığı günәdәk başladığı işlәr vә öyrәtmәyә başladığı tam tәlim barәsindәdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: until he ascended to heaven. He chose men as apostles, and before ascending into heaven, he gave them His commandments by the power of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Göyә qaldırılmazdan әvvәl İsa seçdiyi hәvarilәrә Müqәddәs Ruh vasitәsilә әmrlәr verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: To these he also showed himself alive after he suffered, by many infallible proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days, and speaking about God's Kingdom.

block.text: Ölüm әzabını çәkәndәn sonra hәvarilәrә çoxlu inandırıcı dәlillәrlә Özünü diri olaraq göstәrdi. O, qırx gün әrzindә onlara görünәrәk Allahın Padşahlığı barәdә danışırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being assembled together with them, he commanded them,

block.text: İsa onlarla duz-çörәk kәsәndә bu әmri verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

block.text: <<Yerusәlimdәn kәnara çıxmayın, Atanın verdiyi, Mәndәn eşitdiyiniz vәdin hәyata keçmәsini gözlәyin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”

block.text: Belә ki Yәhya su ilә vәftiz edirdi, amma siz bir neçә gündәn sonra Müqәddәs Ruhla vәftiz olacaqsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when they had come together, they asked him,

block.text: Hәvarilәr bir yerә toplaşanda İsadan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are you now restoring the kingdom to Israel?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, İsraildә Padşahlığı indimi bәrpa edәcәksәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It isn't for you to know times or seasons which the Father has set within his own authority.

block.text: <<Atanın hökmü ilә tәyin olunan vaxtları vә tarixlәri bilmәk sizin işiniz deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. You will be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the uttermost parts of the earth.”

block.text: Amma Müqәddәs Ruh üzәrinizә enәndә siz qüvvә alacaqsınız vә Yerusәlimdә, bütün Yәhudeya vә Samariyada, hәmçinin yer üzünün qurtaracağınadәk hәr yerdә Mәnim şahidlәrim olacaqsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said these things, as they were looking, he was taken up, and a cloud received him out of their sight.

block.text: İsa bunları deyәndәn sonra hәvarilәrin gözlәri qarşısında yuxarı qaldırıldı. Bir bulud İsanı götürüb onlardan gizlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they were looking steadfastly into the sky as he went, behold, two men stood by them in white clothing,
who also said,

block.text: İsa göyә qalxanda onlar sәmaya baxırdılar. Elә hәmin an ağ libaslı iki kişi onların yanında peyda olub
soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Galilee, why do you stand looking into the sky? This Jesus, who was received up from you into the sky will come back in the same way as you saw him going into the sky.”

block.text: <<Ey Qalileyalılar, niyә sәmaya baxa-baxa qalmısınız? Aranızdan götürülüb göyә qaldırılan İsanın aparıldığını necә gördünüzsә, elә dә qayıdacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day's journey away.

block.text: Bundan sonra hәvarilәr Zeytun dağı adlanan yerdәn Yerusәlimә endi. Bu dağ Yerusәlimin yaxınlığındadır, oraya olan mәsafә Şәnbә yolu qәdәrdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come in, they went up into the upper room, where they were staying. Those present were: Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the son of James.

block.text: Onlar şәhәrә girib qaldıqları evin yuxarı otağına çıxdılar. Oradakılar bunlar idi: Peter, Yәhya, Yaqub, Andrey, Filip, Tomas, Bartalmay, Matta, Halfay oğlu Yaqub, Millәtçi Şimon vә Yaqub oğlu Yәhuda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

block.text: İsanın anası Mәryәmlә qardaşları vә başqa qadınlar da hәvarilәrlә birlikdә dayanmadan dua edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In these days, Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (and the number of names was about one hundred twenty), and said,

block.text: Hәmin günlәrdә tәxminәn yüz iyirmi bacı-qardaşdan ibarәt olan toplantı arasından Peter qalxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, it was necessary that this Scripture should be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who was guide to those who took Jesus.

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, İsanı tutanlara yol göstәrәn Yәhuda haqqında Müqәddәs Ruhun Davudun dili ilә әvvәlcәdәn dediyi Müqәddәs Yazı sözlәri yerinә yetmәlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was numbered with us, and received his portion in this ministry.

block.text: Yәhuda bizә qoşuldu, bu xidmәtdәn ona da pay düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now this man obtained a field with the reward for his wickedness, and falling headlong, his body burst open, and all his intestines gushed out.

block.text: Bu adam etdiyi haqsızlığın haqqına bir tarla satın aldı, sonra da oradan kәllәmayallaq aşıb qarnı yırtıldı vә bağırsaqları töküldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It became known to everyone who lived in Jerusalem that in their language that field was called ‘Akeldama,’ that is, ‘The field of blood.’

block.text: Bütün Yerusәlim әhalisi bunu eşitdi vә o yeri öz dillәrindә “Haqal-Dema”, yәni “Qan Tarlası” adlandırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is written in the book of Psalms, ‘Let his habitation be made desolate. Let no one dwell therein;’ and, ‘Let another take his office.’”

block.text: Axı Zәbur kitabında yazılıb: “Mәskәni viran olsun, Kimsәsiz, boş qalsın” vә “Vәzifәsini başqası tutsun”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore, the man who will replace Judas should be one of the men who accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus was with us.

block.text: “Therefore, the man who will replace Judas should be one of the men who accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus was with us.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He must have been with Jesus from the day he was baptised by John, to the day that he was received up to Heaven from us. He must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

block.text: He must have been with Jesus from the day he was baptised by John, to the day that he was received up to Heaven from us. He must become a witness with us of his resurrection.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: They put forward two, Joseph called Barsabbas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
They prayed, and said,

block.text: Belәliklә, iki nәfәri – Barsabba çağırılan, hәm dә Yust adlanan Yusifi vә Mattiyanı namizәd göstәrdilәr.
Sonra dua etdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all men, show which one of these two you have chosen
to take part in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas fell away, that he might go to his own place.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, Sәn hamının ürәyindәn xәbәrdarsan. Bu iki nәfәrdәn birini seçib bizә göstәr ki,
qoy onlardan biri bu xidmәtә – hәvari vәzifәsinә keçsin. Çünki Yәhuda öz yerini tutsun deyә bu işi atdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They drew lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.

block.text: Sonra püşk atdılar. Püşk Mattiyaya düşdü vә o, hәvari sırasına – on bir nәfәrin yanına keçdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 2
Now when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all with one accord in one place.

block.text: Әllinci Gün bayramı zamanı onların hamısı bir yerә yığılmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly there came from the sky a sound like the rushing of a mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.

block.text: Birdәn güclü külәk uğultusu kimi göydәn bir sәs gәlib onlar oturan evin hәr tәrәfini bürüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.

block.text: Onlara göründü ki, nә isә alov kimi dillәrә parçalanaraq hәr birinin üstünә düşür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other languages, as the Spirit gave them the ability to speak.

block.text: Onların hamısı Müqәddәs Ruhla doldu vә Ruhun danışdırdığına görә başqa dillәrdә danışmağa başladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under the sky.

block.text: Bu vaxt sәma altında mövcud olan bütün millәtlәr arasından gәlәn mömin Yәhudilәr Yerusәlimdә yaşayırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When this sound was heard, the multitude came together, and were bewildered, because everyone heard them speaking in his own language.

block.text: Bu sәs gәlәndә orada böyük izdiham toplandı. Hamı öz dilindә danışıldığını eşidәndә çaş-baş qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another,

block.text: Mat qalaraq heyrәt içindә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, aren't all these who speak Galileans?

block.text: <<Bu danışanların hamısı Qalileyalı deyilmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: How do we hear, everyone in our own native language?

block.text: Bәs necә olur ki, biz hamımız öz ana dilimizi eşidirik?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Parthians, Medes, Elamites, and people from Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,

block.text: Biz Parfiyalılar, Midiyalılar, Elamlılar, Mesopotamiyada, Yәhudeyada, Kappadokiyada, Pontda vә Asiya vilayәtindә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, the parts of Libya around Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes,

block.text: Frigiyada, Pamfiliyada, Misirdә vә Liviyanın Kirenaya yaxın bölgәlәrindә yaşayanlar, Romada yaşayan

ReferenceBlocks.text: Cretans and Arabians: we hear them speaking in our languages the mighty works of God!”

block.text: Yәhudilәr vә Yәhudi dinini qәbul edәnlәr, Kritlilәr, Әrәblәr eşidirik ki, onlar bizim dilimizdә Allahın әzәmәtli işlәrindәn danışır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed, and were perplexed, saying one to another,

block.text: Hamı mat qalıb çaşqınlıq içindә bir-birindәn soruşurdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this mean?”

block.text: <<Bu nәdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others, mocking, said,

block.text: Bәzilәri dә rişxәndlә deyirdi:

block.characterId: Jews, God-fearing from every nation, some

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews, God-fearing from every nation, some
ReferenceBlocks.text: “They are filled with new wine.”

block.text: <<Bunlar şirin şәrabdan sәrxoş olublar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and spoke out to them,

block.text: Peter On Bir hәvari ilә bәrabәr irәli çıxdı vә izdihama ucadan nida etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Judea, and all you who dwell at Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and listen to my words.

block.text: <<Ey Yәhudilәr vә Yerusәlimin bütün sakinlәri, sizә bildirirәm, sözlәrimә qulaq asın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these aren't drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day.

block.text: Bu adamlar fikirlәşdiyiniz kimi sәrxoş deyil. Hәlә günün üçüncü saatıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this is what has been spoken through the prophet Joel:

block.text: Bu gördüklәriniz Yoel peyğәmbәr vasitәsilә әvvәlcәdәn deyilәn hadisәdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘It will be in the last days, says God, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh. Your sons and your daughters will prophesy. Your young men will see visions. Your old men will dream dreams.

block.text: Allah dedi ki, axır zamanda “Bütün bәşәr üzәrinә Ruhumdan tökәcәyәm. Oğullarınız vә qızlarınız peyğәmbәrlik edәcәk, Cavanlarınız görüntülәr, Ağsaqqallarınızsa röyalar görәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and on my servants and on my handmaidens in those days, I will pour out my Spirit, and they will prophesy.

block.text: O günlәrdә qul vә qarabaşların üzәrinә dә Ruhumdan tökәcәyәm, Onlar da peyğәmbәrlik edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will show wonders in the sky above, and signs on the earth beneath; blood, and fire, and billows of smoke.

block.text: Yuxarıda – göylәrdә xariqәlәr, Aşağıda – yerdә әlamәtlәr göstәrәcәyәm: Qan, alov vә tüstü buxarları görünәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

block.text: Rәbbin möhtәşәm vә әzәmәtli günü gәlmәzdәn әvvәl Günәş qaranlığa vә ay qan rәnginә dönәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be, that whoever will call on the name of the Lord will be saved.’”

block.text: Rәbbin adını çağıran hәr kәs xilas olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, hear these words! Jesus of Nazareth was a man approved by God to you by mighty works and wonders and signs which God did by him in the midst of you, even as you yourselves know.

block.text: <<Ey İsraillilәr, bu sözlәrimә qulaq asın! Bildiyiniz kimi Allahın aranızda Nazaretli İsa vasitәsilә yaratdığı möcüzәlәr, xariqәlәr vә әlamәtlәr aydın göstәrdi ki, O, Allahdan gәlәn Şәxsdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was handed over to you by the determined counsel and foreknowledge of God, and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to a cross.

block.text: Allahın әzәldәn bilib müәyyәn etdiyi mәqsәdә uyğun olaraq siz bu Şәxsi qanunsuzlara tәslim edib onların әli ilә çarmıxa mıxlatdıraraq öldürdünüz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: whom God raised up, having freed him from the agony of death, because it was not possible that he should be held by it.

block.text: Allah isә ölüm әzablarını kәsәrәk Onu diriltdi. Çünki Onu ölüm tutub saxlaya bilmәzdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David says concerning him, ‘I saw the Lord always before my face, For he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved.

block.text: Davud da Onun barәsindә demişdi: “Rәbbә әbәdilik üz tutmuşam, Sağımda olduğu üçün sarsılmaram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore my heart was glad, and my tongue rejoiced. Moreover my flesh also will dwell in hope.

block.text: Elә bunun üçün qәlbim sevinir, dilim şad olur, Cismim belә, ümidlә yaşayır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will not leave my soul in Hades, neither will you allow your Holy One to see decay.

block.text: Çünki mәni ölülәr diyarına atmazsan, Mömin insanını çürümәyә qoymazsan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.’”

block.text: Mәnә hәyat yolunu öyrәdirsәn, Hüzurunda mәnә doyunca sevinc verirsәn”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I may tell you freely of the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, sizә cәsarәtlә demәliyәm ki, doğrudan da, ulu babamız Davud ölüb vә dәfn olunub. Onun qәbri bu günә qәdәr buradadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, he would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne,

block.text: Davud peyğәmbәr idi vә öz nәslindәn bir Nәfәri onun taxtına çıxarmaq üçün Allahın and içәrәk Davuda vәd etdiyini bilirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: he foreseeing this spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was his soul left in Hades, nor did his flesh see decay.

block.text: Ona görә Mәsihin dirilmәsini әvvәlcәdәn görüb barәsindә demişdi ki, Allah Onu ölülәr diyarına atmaz, Cismini çürümәyә qoymaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This Jesus God raised up, to which we all are witnesses.

block.text: Allah bu İsanı ölümdәn diriltdi vә hamımız buna şahid olduq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being therefore exalted by the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this, which you now see and hear.

block.text: Allah Onu ucaltdı vә sağ әlindә oturtdu. O, vәd edilәn Müqәddәs Ruhu Atadan götürüb sizin görüb-eşitdiyiniz kimi üstümüzә tökdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David didn't ascend into the heavens, but he says himself, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit by my right hand,
until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’”

block.text: Davud özü göylәrә qalxmadı, amma belә dedi: “Rәbb mәnim Ağama dedi:
‹Mәn düşmәnlәrini ayaqlarının altına kәtil kimi salanadәk Sağımda otur›”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let all the house of Israel therefore know certainly that God has made him both Lord and Christ, this Jesus whom you crucified.”

block.text: Ona görә dә qoy bütün İsrail xalqı möhkәm bilsin ki, Allah sizin çarmıxa çәkdiyiniz bu İsanı hәm Rәbb, hәm dә Mәsih tәyin etmişdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles,

block.text: Bu sözlәr ona qulaq asanların ürәyinә ox kimi sancıldı. Onlar hәm Peterdәn, hәm dә o biri hәvarilәrdәn soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, what shall we do?”

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, bәs biz nә edәk?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to them,

block.text: Peter onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: <<Tövbә edin, hamınız İsa Mәsihin adı ilә vәftiz olun. Onda günahlarınız bağışlanacaq vә bәxşiş olaraq Müqәddәs Ruhu alacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.”

block.text: Çünki bu vәd siz, övladlarınız, uzaqdakıların hamısı – Allahımız Rәbbin çağırdığı hәr kәs üçündür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With many other words he testified, and exhorted them, saying,

block.text: Peter başqa çox söz deyib onlara xәbәrdarlıq etdi vә yalvardı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Save yourselves from this crooked generation!”

block.text: <<Bu әyri nәsildәn xilas olun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized. There were added that day about three thousand souls.

block.text: Onun sözünü qәbul edәnlәr vәftiz oldu. O gün üç min nәfәrә yaxın insan imanlılara qoşuldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They continued steadfastly in the apostles’ teaching and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and prayer.

block.text: Onlar da özlәrini hәvarilәrin tәliminә, hәr şeydә şәrik olmağa, birgә çörәk bölmәyә vә duaya hәsr etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.

block.text: Bütün imanlıların ürәyinә qorxu düşdü. Hәvarilәr vasitәsilә çoxlu xariqәlәr vә әlamәtlәr göstәrilirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who believed were together, and had all things in common.

block.text: İman edәnlәrin hamısı bir yerdә idi, bütün әmlaklarından da birgә istifadә edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sold their possessions and goods, and distributed them to all, according as anyone had need.

block.text: Onlar mallarını, mülklәrini satıb pulu hәr kәsә ehtiyacına görә paylayırdılar;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Day by day, continuing steadfastly with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread at home, they took their food with gladness and singleness of heart.

block.text: hәr gün mәbәdә yığılmaqda davam edir, evlәrdә sevinә-sevinә, sәmimi qәlbdәn çörәk bölüb yeyirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They praised God, and had favor with all the people. The Lord added to the assembly day by day those who were being saved.

block.text: Onlar Allaha hәmd edir vә bütün xalq qarşısında lütf qazanırdı. Rәbb isә hәr gün insanları xilas edir vә imanlılara qoşurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 3
Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.

block.text: Bir gün Peterlә Yәhya doqquzuncu saatda, dua vaxtı mәbәdә gedirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple.

block.text: Bu zaman anadangәlmә ayaqları şikәst olan bir kişi mәbәdin Gözәl adlı qapısına gәtirilirdi. Hәr gün bu adamı ona görә oraya gәtirәrdilәr ki, mәbәdә gәlib-gedәnlәrdәn dilәnәrәk nәzir alsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy.
Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said,

block.text: O, mәbәdә girәn Peterlә Yәhyanı görüb onlardan nәzir istәdi.
Peterlә Yәhya ona diqqәtlә baxdı. Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look at us.”

block.text: <<Bizә bax>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them.
But Peter said,

block.text: Bu kişi onlardan nә isә umaraq gözlәrini onların üzünә dikdi.
Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Silver and gold have I none, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”

block.text: <<Nә qızılım, nә dә gümüşüm var ki, sәnә verim. Nәyim varsa, sәnә onu verirәm. Nazaretli İsa Mәsihin adı ilә qalx, gәz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength.

block.text: Sonra onu sağ әlindәn tutub qaldırdı. Bu kişinin topuqları vә ayaqları dәrhal qüvvәt aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God.

block.text: Atılaraq ayağa qalxdı vә yerimәyә başladı. Qaçıb tullana-tullana, Allaha hәmd edәrәk onlarla bәrabәr mәbәdә girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people saw him walking and praising God.

block.text: Bütün xalq gördü ki, bu kişi yeriyir vә Allaha hәmd edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They recognized him. They knew that he was the crippled man who used to sit begging at the temple gate. They were filled with wonder, and they said:

block.text: Onlar onu tanınır. Onlar bilirdim ki, o, kimin məbədi qapısında edilib dilənçiliklə oturmaq üçün istifadə şikəst adam idi. Onlar təəccüb dolu idi, və onlar:

block.characterId: people in temple courts, all the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people in temple courts, all the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What has happened to him is truly amazing!”

block.text: "Ona baş saxladığınız həqiqətən inanılmaz var!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon's, greatly wondering.

block.text: Bu kişi Peterin vә Yәhyanın әlindәn yapışdı. Heyrәtә düşәn bütün xalq onlara tәrәf, Süleymanın eyvanı adlanan yerә qaçdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter saw it, he responded to the people,

block.text: Bunu görәn Peter xalqa nida etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?

block.text: <<Ey İsraillilәr, burada heyrәtamiz nә var ki? Niyә gözlәrinizi bizә dikib baxırsınız? Elә bil biz öz qüvvәmizlә, öz möminliyimizlә bu kişinin yerimәsinә sәbәb olmuşuq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him.

block.text: İbrahimin Allahı, İshaqın Allahı vә Yaqubun Allahı, ata-babalarımızın Allahı Qulu İsanı izzәtlәndirib. Siz Onu sataraq Pilatın qarşısında rәdd etdiniz. Pilat Onu azad etmәk üçün qәrar vermişdi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you.

block.text: amma siz Müqәddәs vә Saleh Olanı rәdd edib bir qatilin azad edilmәsini istәdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses.

block.text: Siz Hәyat Banisini öldürdünüz, amma Allah Onu ölülәr arasından diriltdi. Biz bunun şahidlәriyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.”

block.text: Gördüyünüz vә tanıdığınız bu kişi İsanın adı sayәsindә, Onun adına olan imanla sağaldı. İsa vasitәsilә olan imanla bu kişi hamınızın gözü qarşısında tam şәfa tapdı.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers.

block.text: <<İndi, ey qardaşlar, bilirәm ki, rәhbәrlәriniz kimi siz dә bunu bilmәdәn etmisiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.”

block.text: Amma Allah peyğәmbәrlәrin dili ilә Öz Mәsihinin әzab çәkmәsi barәdә әvvәlcәdәn bәyan etdiyini yerinә yetirdi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord,
and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before.

block.text: <<Belәliklә, günahlarınız silinsin deyә tövbә edib Allaha tәrәf dönün ki,
Rәbbin hüzurunda rahatlıq vaxtı tapasınız vә O da sizin üçün әvvәlcәdәn tәyin olunan Mәsihi, yәni İsanı göndәrsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But for awhile, he must remain in heaven, until the times of restoration of all things, which God spoke long ago by the mouth of his holy prophets.

block.text: Çünki Allahın qәdimdәn bәri müqәddәs peyğәmbәrlәrinin dili ilә mәlum etdiyi kimi hәr şeyin yenidәn hazırlanacağı vaxtacan İsanın sәmada qalması lazımdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses indeed said to the fathers, ‘The Lord God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him in all things whatever he says to you.

block.text: Musa belә demişdi: “Allahınız Rәbb sizin üçün öz soydaşlarınız içәrisindәn mәnim kimi bir peyğәmbәr yetirәcәk. Sizә nә söylәyәcәksә, ona qulaq asın”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be, that every soul that will not listen to that prophet will be utterly destroyed from among the people.’

block.text: “Bu peyğәmbәrә qulaq asmayan hәr adam xalqı arasından ayrılıb mәhv edilәcәk”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and all the prophets from Samuel and those who followed after, as many as have spoken, they also told of these days.

block.text: Şamueldәn başlayaraq bütün peyğәmbәrlәr bu günlәri elan etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘In your seed will all the families of the earth be blessed.’

block.text: Siz dә peyğәmbәrlәrin varislәri, Allahın ata-babalarınızla kәsdiyi Әhdin varislәrisiniz. Allah İbrahimә demişdi: “Yer üzünün bütün tayfaları sәnin nәslinin vasitәsilә xeyir-dua alacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God, having raised up his servant, Jesus, sent him to you first, to bless you, in turning away everyone of you from your wickedness.”

block.text: Allah hәr birinizi pis әmәllәrinizdәn döndәrmәk vә xeyir-dua vermәk üçün Öz Qulunu dirildәrәk әvvәlcә sizin yanınıza göndәrdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 4
As they spoke to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees came to them.

block.text: Kahinlәr, mәbәd mühafizәçilәrinin başçısı vә sadukeylәr xalqa vәz edәn Peterlә Yәhyanın üstünә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were upset because they taught the people and proclaimed in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.

block.text: Çünki bu hәvarilәrin xalqı öyrәtmәsinә, İsaya şamil edәrәk ölülәr arasından dirilmәni bәyan etmәsinә qıcıqlandılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was now evening.

block.text: Onları tutdular vә axşam olduğu üçün sabahkı günә qәdәr zindanda saxladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many of those who heard the word believed, and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.

block.text: Lakin onların sözünә qulaq asanlardan bir çoxu iman etdi. Belәliklә, iman edәn kişilәrin sayı beş minә qәdәr çatdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in the morning, that their rulers, elders, and scribes were gathered together in Jerusalem.

block.text: Ertәsi gün Yәhudilәrin rәhbәrlәri, ağsaqqalları vә ilahiyyatçıları Yerusәlimә toplaşdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest.

block.text: Baş kahin Xanan, Qayafa, Yәhya, İsgәndәr vә baş kahinin nәslindәn olanların hamısı orada idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had stood them in the middle of them, they inquired,

block.text: Peterlә Yәhyanı onların qarşısına gәtirib soruşdular:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what power, or in what name, have you done this?”

block.text: <<Siz bunu hansı qüvvә ilә, kimin adı ilә edirsiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them,

block.text: O zaman Peter Müqәddәs Ruhla dolub dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
are we being examined today concerning a good deed done to a crippled man? Are you asking by what means this man has been healed?

block.text: <<Ey xalqın rәhbәrlәri vә ağsaqqalları!
Әgәr bu gün biz bir xәstәyә etdiyimiz yaxşılığa vә onun necә sağalmasına görә sorğu-suala çәkiliriksә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole.

block.text: hamınız, bütün İsrail xalqı bilsin ki, bu adam sizin çarmıxa çәkdiyiniz, lakin Allahın ölülәr arasından diriltdiyi Nazaretli İsa Mәsihin adı ilә qarşınızda sağlam durub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is ‘the stone which was regarded as worthless by you, the builders, which has become the head of the corner.’

block.text: Siz “bәnnaların rәdd etdiyi daş guşәdaşı olan” hәmin İsadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is salvation in none other, for neither is there any other name under heaven, that is given among men, by which we must be saved!”

block.text: Ondan başqa heç kimdә xilas yoxdur. Çünki sәma altında biz insanlara verilәn başqa bir ad yoxdur ki, onun vasitәsilә xilas olaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and had perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marveled, saying:

block.text: İndi onlar, Peter vә Yәhyanın və cəsarət gördüm ki, onlar və cahil idi cahil kişilər, onlar heyran idi dedi qəbul olmuşdur:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men are disciples of Jesus!”

block.text: "Bu kişilər İsa həvarilərə var!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

block.text: Şәfa tapan adam Peter vә Yәhya ilә birgә onların gözlәri qarşısında durmuşdu, buna görә onların әleyhinә heç nә deyә bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
saying,

block.text: Ali Şuranın üzvlәri onlara bayıra çıxmağı әmr edәndәn sonra aralarında müzakirәyә başlayıb
dedilәr:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What shall we do to these men? Because indeed a notable miracle has been done through them, as can be plainly seen by all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we can't deny it.

block.text: <<Bu adamlara nә edәk? Bütün Yerusәlim әhalisinә aydın olub ki, bu adamların әli ilә әhәmiyyәtli bir әlamәt göstәrilib vә biz bunu dana bilmәrik.

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: But so that this spreads no further among the people, let's threaten them, that from now on they don't speak to anyone in this name.”

block.text: Amma bu xәbәrin xalq arasında daha çox yayılmasının qarşısını almaq üçün onlara hәdә-qorxu gәlәk ki, bundan sonra bu Adı çәkib heç kimә heç nә demәsinlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called them and commanded them, saying:

block.text: Onlar adlı və onlara əmr edib dedi:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)/Caiaphas, the high priest/John, Alexander, and other men of the high priest's family/elders/teachers of religious law/Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not preach in the name of Jesus any more!”

block.text: "Daha çox İsa adı vəz etmə!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter and John answered them,

block.text: Lakin Peterlә Yәhya cavab verib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than to God, judge for yourselves.”

block.text: <<Özünüz qәrar verin, Allaha deyil, sizә qulaq asmaq Allahın gözündә nә qәdәr doğrudur?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We can't help telling the things which we saw and heard.”

block.text: Axı eşidib-gördüklәrimizi demәyә bilmәrik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way to punish them, because of the people; for everyone glorified God for that which was done.

block.text: Ali Şuranın üzvlәri onlara cәza vermәk üçün imkan tapa bilmәdiklәrinә görә onları bir daha hәdәlәyәndәn sonra azadlığa buraxdılar. Çünki bütün xalq baş verәn hadisәyә görә Allahı izzәtlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the man on whom this miracle of healing was performed was more than forty years old.

block.text: Bu әlamәt vasitәsilә sağalan adamın qırxdan artıq yaşı var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being let go, they came to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

block.text: Azadlığa buraxılan Peter vә Yәhya öz yoldaşlarının yanına gәlib başçı kahinlәrlә ağsaqqalların sözlәrini onlara çatdırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said,

block.text: Yoldaşları bunu eşidәrkәn bir nәfәr kimi Allaha nida etdilәr:

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: “O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them.

block.text: <<Ey Pәrvәrdigarımız, yeri, göyü, dәnizi vә bunların içindәki hәr şeyi yaradan Sәnsәn.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: You said through the mouth of your servant, David, said, ‘Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruh vasitәsilә Öz qulun atamız Davudun dili ilә belә dedin: “Nә üçün millәtlәr belә hirslәnir, Ümmәtlәr boş şeylәr düşünür?

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: The kings of the earth take a stand, and the rulers take council together, against the Lord, and against his Christ.’”

block.text: Dünya şahları yığışır, Hökmdarlar Rәbbә vә Onun mәsh etdiyinә qarşı birlәşir”.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: “For truly, in this city against your holy child, Jesus, whom you anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together.

block.text: <<Hәqiqәtәn, Hirod vә Ponti Pilat başqa millәtlәr vә İsrail xalqı ilә birlikdә Sәnin mәsh etdiyin müqәddәs Qulun İsanın әleyhinә bu şәhәrdә toplaşdı ki,

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: They were to do whatever your hand and your council foreordained to happen.

block.text: Sәnin әvvәldәn qәrar verdiyin, Sәnin әlindә vә niyyәtindә olan şeylәri hәyata keçirsin.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, Lord, look at their threats, and grant to your servants to speak your word with all boldness.

block.text: İndi, ya Rәbb, onların etdiklәri hәdә-qorxuya bax! Biz qullarına güc ver ki, Sәnin sözlәrini tam cәsarәtlә yayaq.

block.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: apostles, elders, and whole church at Jerusalem/Peter (Simon)/John
ReferenceBlocks.text: May you stretch out your hand to heal and show signs and wonders through the name of your holy child Jesus.”

block.text: Xәstәlәri sağaltmaq üçün әlini uzat vә müqәddәs Qulun İsanın adı ilә әlamәtlәr vә xariqәlәr göstәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were gathered together. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.

block.text: Onlar dualarını qurtaran kimi toplandıqları yer lәrzәyә gәldi vә onların hamısı Müqәddәs Ruhla dolub Allahın kәlamını cәsarәtlә yaymağa başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude of those who believed were of one heart and soul. Not one of them claimed that anything of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.

block.text: İmanlıların hamısı canbir qәlbdә idi. Heç kim öz әmlakına <<bu mәnimdir>> demir, bütün әmlaklarından birgә istifadә edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.

block.text: Hәvarilәr Rәbb İsanın dirilmәsi barәdә böyük qüvvә ilә şәhadәt edirdi vә hamısının üzәrinә bol-bol lütf ehsan olunurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For neither was there among them any who lacked, for as many as were owners of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold,
and laid them at the apostles’ feet, and distribution was made to each, according as anyone had need.

block.text: Onların arasında heç kim yoxsul deyildi. Çünki onların arasında torpaq vә ev sahibi olanlar mülkünü satıb pulunu gәtirәr,
hәvarilәrin ixtiyarına verәrdi. Bu da hәr kәsә ehtiyacına görә paylanardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas (which is, being interpreted, Son of Encouragement), a Levite, a man of Cyprus by race,
having a field, sold it, and brought the money and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

block.text: Mәsәlәn, Kiprdә anadan olan, hәvarilәrin Barnaba adlandırdığı (mәnası) <<Tәsәlli oğlu>> Levili Yusif
sahib olduğu torpaq sahәsini sataraq pulunu gәtirib hәvarilәrin ixtiyarına verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 5
But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession.

block.text: Xananya adında bir kişi arvadı Sapfira ilә razılığa gәlib bir mülk satdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
But Peter said,

block.text: O, pulun bir hissәsini özünә götürüb qalan hissәsini hәvarilәrin ixtiyarına verdi. Arvadının da bu işdәn xәbәri var idi.
Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit, and to keep back part of the price of the land?

block.text: <<Xananya, niyә ürәyinә Şeytanı buraxıb Müqәddәs Ruha yalan söylәyәrәk torpağın pulunun bir hissәsini özünә götürdün?

ReferenceBlocks.text: While you kept it, didn't it remain your own? After it was sold, wasn't it in your power? How is it that you have conceived this thing in your heart? You haven't lied to men, but to God.”

block.text: Bu torpaq satılmamışdan әvvәl sәnin deyildimi? Sәn onu satandan sonra da pul sәnin ixtiyarında deyildimi? Bu nә niyyәtdir, ürәyindә tutmusan? Sәn insanlara deyil, Allaha yalan satdın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and died. Great fear came on all who heard these things.

block.text: Xananya bunları eşidәn kimi yerә yıxıldı vә canı çıxdı. Bunu eşidәn hәr kәsi böyük bir vahimә bürüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young men arose and wrapped him up, and they carried him out and buried him.

block.text: Gәnclәr gәlib Xananyanın meyitini kәfәnә bürüdülәr vә aparıb dәfn etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.
Peter answered her,

block.text: Bundan tәxminәn üç saat sonra Xananyanın arvadı içәri daxil oldu. Onun olub-keçәnlәrdәn heç bir xәbәri yox idi.
Peter ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much.”

block.text: <<Mәnә söylә, torpağı bu qiymәtәmi satdınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said,

block.text: Qadın cavab verdi:

block.characterId: Sapphira, wife of Ananias of Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Sapphira, wife of Ananias of Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, for so much.”

block.text: <<Bәli, o qiymәtә>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter asked her,

block.text: Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How is it that you have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord?

block.text: <<Niyә әlbir olub Rәbbin Ruhunu sınamaq istәdiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”

block.text: Budur, әrini dәfn edәnlәrin ayaq sәslәri qapı ağzındadır, indi dә sәni aparmağa gәlirlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She fell down immediately at his feet, and died.

block.text: Qadın hәmin an Peterin ayaqları qarşısına yıxıldı vә canı çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young men came in and found her dead, and they carried her out and buried her by her husband.

block.text: İçәri daxil olan gәnclәr gördülәr ki, o da ölüb. Onlar onu götürüb әrinin yanında dәfn etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great fear came on the whole assembly, and on all who heard these things.

block.text: Bütün imanlılar cәmiyyәtini vә bu hadisәni eşidәnlәrin hamısını böyük bir vahimә bürüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. They were all with one accord in Solomon's porch.

block.text: Hәvarilәr vasitәsilә xalq arasında çox әlamәtlәr vә xariqәlәr göstәrilirdi. Bütün imanlılar Süleymanın eyvanına yığılardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.

block.text: Xalqın gözündә böyük nüfuz qazansalar da, kәnardan heç kim onlara qoşulmağa cürәt etmirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: More believers were added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women.

block.text: Buna baxmayaraq, get-gedә daha çox qadın vә kişi Rәbbә iman gәtirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They even carried out the sick into the streets, and laid them on cots and mattresses, so that as Peter came by, at the least his shadow might overshadow some of them.

block.text: Buna görә dә Peter yoldan keçәndә heç olmasa kölgәsi xәstәlәrin üstünә düşsün deyә xalq öz xәstәlәrini döşәk vә çarpayı ilә birlikdә küçәlәrә çıxarıb qoyardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Multitudes also came together from the cities around Jerusalem, bringing sick people, and those who were tormented by unclean spirits: and they were all healed.

block.text: Yerusәlimin әtraf şәhәrlәrindә yaşayanlar da axın-axın gәlәr, öz xәstәlәrini vә natәmiz ruhdan әzab çәkәnlәri gәtirәrdi. Onların hamısı şәfa tapardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy.

block.text: Bu, baş kahin vә yanındakıların hamısını, yәni sadukey tәriqәtinә mәnsub olanları hәrәkәtә gәtirdi, çünki qısqanclıqları aşıb-daşırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They laid hands on the apostles and put them in public custody.

block.text: Ona görә hәvarilәri tutub ümumi zindana atdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors by night, and brought them out, and said,

block.text: Amma Rәbbin mәlәyi gecәnin bir vaxtında gәlib zindanın qapısını açdı, onları bayıra çıxarıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.”

block.text: <<Gedin, mәbәddә durun vә camaata yeni hәyatla bağlı sözlәrin hamısını deyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this, they entered into the temple about daybreak, and taught. But the high priest came, and those who were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

block.text: Hәvarilәr bunu eşidәndә sәhәr tezdәn mәbәdә daxil olub tәlimlәrini öyrәtmәyә başladılar. Baş kahin vә yanındakılar gәlib Ali Şuranı – İsrailin bütün ağsaqqallar mәclisini çağırdı ki, bir yerә yığılsınlar. Onlar hәvarilәri gәtirtmәk üçün zindana mühafizәçilәri göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the officers who came didn't find them in the prison. They returned and reported,

block.text: Lakin mühafizәçilәr gәlib zindanda hәvarilәri tapa bilmәdi vә geri qayıdıb belә xәbәr verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”

block.text: <<Gördük ki, zindan bağlıdır, tamamilә nәzarәt altındadır vә gözәtçilәr qapıda dayanıb. Amma qapıları açanda içәridә heç kimi tapa bilmәdik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these words, they were very perplexed about them and wondered:

block.text: Bu sözlәri eşidәn mәbәd mühafizәçilәrinin başçısı ilә başçı kahinlәr

block.characterId: captain of the temple guard/chief priests

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: captain of the temple guard/chief priests
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What will happen now?”

block.text: <<Bu işin sonu necә qurtaracaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One came and told them,

block.text: Elә bu zaman kimsә onların yanına gәlib xәbәr verdi:

block.characterId: person who told the guards and priests where the apostles were

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: person who told the guards and priests where the apostles were
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people.”

block.text: <<Baxın, zindana saldığınız adamlar mәbәddә dayanıb camaata tәlim öyrәdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the captain went with the officers, and brought them without violence, for they were afraid that the people might stone them.

block.text: Bu vaxt başçı ilә mühafizәçilәr gedib hәvarilәri gәtirdi. Xalqın onları daşqalaq etmәsindәn qorxduqları üçün güc tәtbiq etmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had brought them, they set them before the council. The high priest questioned them,
saying,

block.text: Onlar hәvarilәri Ali Şuranın qarşısına gәtirdilәr. Baş kahin onlardan soruşdu:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn't we strictly command you not to teach in this name?

block.text: <<Bu adla tәlim öyrәtmәyi sizә qәti qadağan etmәdikmi?

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and intend to bring this man's blood on us.”

block.text: Amma siz tәliminizi bütün Yerusәlimә yaydınız vә o Adamın qanını bizim boynumuza yüklәmәk istәyirsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter and the apostles answered,

block.text: Peter vә başqa hәvarilәr belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We must obey God rather than men.

block.text: <<İnsana deyil, Allaha itaәt etmәk daha vacibdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.

block.text: Ata-babamızın Allahı sizin çarmıxa çәkib öldürdüyünüz İsanı diriltdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God exalted him with his right hand to be a Prince and a Savior, to give repentance to Israel, and remission of sins.

block.text: İsrailә günahlarından tövbә vә bağışlanma imkanı vermәk üçün Allah Onu Bani vә Xilaskar olaraq Öz sağ tәrәfinә qaldırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.”

block.text: Bu şeylәr barәdә biz şahidik, Allahın Özünә itaәt edәnlәrә verdiyi Müqәddәs Ruh da şahiddir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and determined to kill them.

block.text: Onlar bunu eşidәndә çox qәzәblәndi vә hәvarilәri öldürmәk istәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But one stood up in the council, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, honored by all the people, and commanded to put the apostles out for a little while.
He said to them,

block.text: Lakin bütün xalqın hörmәtini qazanmış Qanun müәllimi olan Qamliel adlı bir farisey Ali Şurada ayağa qalxdı vә әmr etdi ki, bu adamları qısa müddәtә bayıra çıxarsınlar.
O, Ali Şuranın üzvlәrinә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Israel, be careful concerning these men, what you are about to do.

block.text: <<Ey İsraillilәr, bu insanlara nә edәcәyiniz barәdә yaxşı-yaxşı fikirlәşin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For before these days Theudas rose up, making himself out to be somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves: He was slain; and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed, and came to nothing.

block.text: Bir qәdәr bundan әvvәl Tevda özü barәsindә yüksәk iddiada olaraq ortaya çıxdı vә ona tәxminәn dörd yüz nәfәr qoşuldu. Lakin bu kişi öldürüldü, bütün tәrәfdarları darmadağın edildi vә bu hәrәkat yatırıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the enrollment, and drew away some people after him. He also perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad.

block.text: Sonra siyahıyaalma zamanı Qalileyalı Yәhuda ortaya çıxdı vә camaatı ardınca apardı. O da öldü vә tәrәfdarlarının hamısı darmadağın edildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I tell you, withdraw from these men, and leave them alone. For if this counsel or this work is of men, it will be overthrown.

block.text: İndiki iş barәsindә sizә onu deyirәm ki, bu adamlardan әl çәkin vә azad buraxın. Әgәr bu hәrәkat, bu iş insandandırsa, mәhv olub gedәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow it, and you would be found even to be fighting against God!”

block.text: Yox, әgәr Allahdandırsa, bu adamların işini mәhv edә bilmәzsiniz. Allaha qarşı çıxanların vәziyyәtinә belә, düşә bilәrsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They agreed with him. Summoning the apostles, they beat them and commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.

block.text: Onlar Qamlielin sözünә baxdılar, hәvarilәri içәri çağırıb qamçılatdılar vә әmr etdilәr ki, İsanın adını çәkәrәk heç nә danışmasınlar. Sonra onları azad etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer dishonor for Jesus’ name.

block.text: Hәvarilәr bu ad uğrunda tәhqirә layiq görüldüklәri üçün sevinәrәk Ali Şuranın önündәn ayrıldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every day, in the temple and at home, they never stopped teaching and preaching Jesus, the Christ.

block.text: Onlar hәr gün mәbәddә vә evlәrdә tәlim öyrәtmәkdәn, İsanın Mәsih olması barәdә Müjdәni yaymaqdan әl çәkmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 6
Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service.

block.text: O günlәrdә – şagirdlәrin çoxaldığı vaxtda yunanca danışan Yәhudilәr ibranicә danışan Yәhudilәrdәn şikayәt etmәyә başladı. Çünki gündәlik yardım paylananda onların dul qadınlarını nәzәrә almamışdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said,

block.text: Ona görә On İki hәvari bütün şagirdlәri bir yerә yığıb belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not appropriate for us to forsake the word of God and serve tables.

block.text: <<Allahın kәlamını vәz etmәk işini atıb maddi işlәrlә mәşğul olmağımız düzgün deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

block.text: Ey qardaşlar, aranızda etibar qazanmış, Ruh vә hikmәtlә dolu olan yeddi kişi seçin ki, onları bu işә tәyin edәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we will continue steadfastly in prayer and in the ministry of the word.”

block.text: Biz isә özümüzü duaya vә Allahın kәlamını yaymağa hәsr edәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These words pleased the whole multitude. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolaus, a proselyte of Antioch.

block.text: Bu sözlәr bütün toplantının xoşuna gәldi. Stefanı, Filipi, Proxoru, Nikanoru, Timonu, Parmenanı vә Yәhudi dinini qәbul edәn Antakyalı Nikolanı seçdilәr. Stefan iman vә Müqәddәs Ruhla dolu bir kişi idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They set them before the apostles. When they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.

block.text: Bunları hәvarilәrin qarşısına çıxardılar. Hәvarilәr dә dua edib onların üzәrinә әl qoydular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The word of God increased and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem exceedingly. A great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.

block.text: Allahın kәlamı yayılır, Yerusәlimdә şagirdlәrin sayı xeyli artır vә bir çox kahinlәr dә bu imana tabe olurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Stephen, full of faith and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.

block.text: Lütf vә qüvvә ilә dolu olan Stefan xalq arasında böyük xariqә vә әlamәtlәr göstәrirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of those who were of the synagogue called “The Libertines,” and of the Cyrenians, of the Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia arose, disputing with Stephen.

block.text: Belә olanda Azadlar Sinaqoqu adlanan sinaqoqun bәzi üzvlәri, Kirenalılardan, İsgәndәriyyәlilәrdәn, Kilikiyadan vә Asiya vilayәtindәn bәzi insanlar Stefana qarşı çıxıb onunla mübahisәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weren't able to withstand the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.

block.text: Amma Stefanın sözündәki hikmәtin vә Ruhun qarşısında dayana bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they secretly induced men to say,

block.text: Onda bir neçә nәfәri şirniklәndirdilәr ki, belә desinlәr:

block.characterId: Jews of Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia & Asia

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Jews of Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia & Asia
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”

block.text: <<Bu adamın hәm Musaya, hәm dә Allaha qarşı küfr dolu sözlәr dediyini eşitmişik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes. Then they came against Stephen and seized him, and brought him in to the council.

block.text: Belәliklә, xalqı, ağsaqqalları vә ilahiyyatçıları da tәşvişә saldılar. Stefanın üstünә gәlib onu tutdular vә Ali Şuranın qarşısına gәtirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They set up false witnesses who said,

block.text: Gәtirdiklәri yalançı şahidlәr onun üzünә durub dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.

block.text: <<Bu adam dayanmadan bu Müqәddәs mәkana vә Qanuna qarşı danışır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”

block.text: “Nazaretli İsa bu mәkanı darmadağın edәcәk” vә Musadan bizә әmanәt qalan adәtlәri dәyişәcәk>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

block.text: Ali Şurada oturanların hamısı Stefana diqqәtlә baxanda gördü ki, onun üzü bir mәlәyin üzünә bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 7
The high priest said,

block.text: Baş kahin Stefandan soruşdu:

block.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: Ananias (Annas), the high priest (father-in-law of Caiaphas)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are these things so?”

block.text: <<Bunlar doğrudurmu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Stefan belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran.

block.text: <<Qardaşlar vә atalar, mәni dinlәyin! Atamız İbrahim hәlә Mesopotamiyada ikәn Xaranda mәskunlaşmazdan әvvәl izzәtli Allah ona göründü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God said to him, ‘Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.’

block.text: Ona belә dedi: “Öz torpağından, qohumlarının arasından çıx, sәnә göstәrәcәyim torpağa get”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living.

block.text: Buna görә İbrahim Xaldeylilәrin ölkәsini tәrk edib Xarana köçdü. Atasının ölümündәn sonra Allah onu oradan da götürüb sizin indi yaşadığınız bu ölkәyә gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. God promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he still had no child.

block.text: Burada ona irs olaraq bir qarış belә, torpaq vermәdi. Amma İbrahimin o zaman hәlә övladı olmasa da, Allah bu torpağı mülk olaraq ona vә onun gәlәcәk nәslinә verәcәyini vәd etmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God spoke in this way: that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.

block.text: Allah ona belә dedi: “Nәslin yad ölkәdә qәrib olacaq, orada olan millәtә kölәlik edәcәk vә onlara dörd yüz il zülm edilәcәk”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,’ said God, ‘and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.’

block.text: “Ancaq onların kölәlik edәcәklәri millәti Özüm cәzalandıracağam” dedi Allah, “bundan sonra oradan çıxacaqlar” vә “bu yerdә Mәnә ibadәt edәcәklәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.”

block.text: Sonra Allah onunla sünnәtlә bağlı Әhd kәsdi. Belәliklә dә, İbrahim İshaqın atası olarkәn onu sәkkiz günlük olanda sünnәt etdi. Bundan sonra İshaqdan Yaqub, Yaqubdan da on iki ulu babamız törәdi.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him

block.text: <<Bu ulu babalarımız paxıllıqdan Yusifi qul kimi Misirә satdı. Lakin Allah Yusifә yar idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He delivered him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house.

block.text: Onu bütün әziyyәtlәrdәn qurtardı vә ona hikmәt verәrәk Misir hökmdarı fironun gözündә lütf qazandırdı. Firon onu Misirin vә öz sarayında olan bütün xalqın rәhbәri tәyin etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food.

block.text: Sonra bütün Misir vә Kәnan torpağı aclıq vә böyük әziyyәtlәrlә üzlәşdi. Bu ata-babalarımız yemәk tapa bilmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time.

block.text: Yaqub eşidәndә ki, Misirdә taxıl var, bu ata-babalarımızı birinci dәfә oraya göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh.

block.text: Onlar ikinci dәfә Misirә gәlәndә Yusif qardaşlarına özünü tanıtdı. Bununla da firon Yusifin ailәsi ilә tanış oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.

block.text: Yusif atası Yaquba xәbәr göndәrib onunla birgә bütün qohumlarını – yetmiş beş nәfәri çağırtdırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died. Our forefathers died there also.

block.text: Belәliklә, Yaqub Misirә getdi. Özü ilә bu ata-babalarımız da orada öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.”

block.text: Onların cәsәdlәri sonradan Şekemә gәtirildi vә Şekemdә İbrahimin Xamor övladlarından bir neçә gümüşә satın aldığı qәbirdә dәfn olundu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt.

block.text: <<Allahın İbrahimә bәyan etdiyi vәdin hәyata keçdiyi vaxt yaxınlaşanda Misirdәki xalqımızın sayı bir xeyli çoxalmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then there arose a different king, who didn't know Joseph.

block.text: Axırda Misirdә Yusifi tanımayan yeni bir padşah taxta çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn't stay alive.

block.text: Bu adam soydaşlarımıza hiylә işlәtdi, zorakılıqla ata-babalarımızı mәcbur etdi ki, yeni doğulan körpәlәrini sağ qalmasın deyә bayıra atsınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At that time Moses was born, and was exceedingly handsome. He was nourished three months in his father's house.

block.text: Bu dövrdә son dәrәcә gözәl bir körpә olan Musa doğuldu. O, üç ay atasının evindә bәslәndi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was thrown out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up, and reared him as her own son.

block.text: Sonra o da bayıra atıldı. Onu fironun qızı tapıb özünә övlad etdi vә öz oğlu kimi böyütdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He was mighty in his words and works.

block.text: Musa Misirlilәrin bütün elmi biliklәrinә bağlı tәrbiyә alıb söz vә әmәlindә güclü bir şәxsiyyәt oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.

block.text: Musa qırx yaşına çatanda ürәyindә soydaşları İsrail övladlarının vәziyyәtini yaxından bilmәk arzusu oyandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, striking the Egyptian.

block.text: Onlardan birinin zәrәr çәkdiyini görәndә Musa onu müdafiә etdi. Zәrәr vuran Misirlini öldürәrәk әzilәn insanın intiqamını aldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn't understand.”

block.text: O belә fikirlәşdi: “Soydaşlarım dәrk edәcәklәr ki, mәnim vasitәmlә Allah onları xilas edir”. Amma onlar bunu dәrk etmәdilәr.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?’

block.text: Ertәsi gün Musa dalaşan iki İsraillini görәndә onları barışdırmaq istәdi vә dedi: “Ay kişilәr, siz soydaşsınız, niyә bir-birinizә zәrәr vurursunuz?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?

block.text: Lakin soydaşına zәrәr vuran kişi Musanı itәlәyib dedi: “Sәni bizim üstümüzә kim başçı vә hakim qoyub?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

block.text: Yoxsa dünәn Misirlini öldürdüyün kimi mәni dә öldürmәk fikrindәsәn?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.”

block.text: Bu sözә görә Musa qaçdı. O, Midyan torpağında, qürbәtdә yaşadı vә orada iki oğul atası oldu.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush.

block.text: Qırx il keçәndәn sonra Musa Sina dağının yaxınlığındakı sәhrada olanda mәlәk ona bir kol arasından od-alov içәrisindә göründü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him and said:

block.text: Musa gördüklәrinә heyrәtlәndi. Baxmaq üçün oraya yaxınlaşanda Rәbbin sәsini eşitdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ Moses trembled, and dared not look.

block.text: “Mәn ata-babalarının Allahı – İbrahimin, İshaqın vә Yaqubun Allahıyam”. Musa qorxusundan lәrzәyә gәlib baxmağa belә, cәsarәt etmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him, ‘Take your sandals off of your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.

block.text: Rәbb ona dedi: “Ayaqlarından çarıqlarını çıxart, çünki durduğun yer müqәddәs torpaqdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.’”

block.text: Hәqiqәtәn, Mәn Misirdә olan xalqımın әziyyәtini gördüm, fәryadlarını eşitdim vә onları qurtarmaq üçün endim. İndi get, Mәn sәni Misirә göndәrirәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This Moses, whom they refused, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’--God has sent him as both a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.

block.text: Bu, hәmin Musadır ki, onu rәdd edib demişdilәr: “Sәni bizim üstümüzә kim başçı vә hakim qoyub?” Amma Allah Musanı bir kol arasında görünәn mәlәyin әli ilә başçı vә qurtarıcı olaraq göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man led them out, having worked wonders and signs in Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness for forty years.

block.text: O, xalqı Misirdәn çıxaran, hәm orada, hәm Qırmızı dәnizdә, hәm dә qırx il әrzindә sәhrada xariqә vә әlamәtlәr yaradan insan idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is that Moses, who said to the children of Israel, ‘The Lord our God will raise up a prophet for you from among your brothers, like me; him shall you hear’

block.text: İsrail övladlarına “Allah mәni yetirdiyi kimi sizin üçün öz soydaşlarınız içәrisindәn bir peyğәmbәr yetirәcәk” deyәn bu Musadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel that spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, who received living oracles to give to us.

block.text: Bu, hәmin adamdır ki, Sina dağında onunla danışan mәlәklә vә ata-babalarımızla birgә sәhradakı cәmiyyәtdә olmuşdu. O, canlı sözlәr almışdı ki, bizә versin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Our forefathers would not listen to him but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt.

block.text: Ata-babalarımızsa Musanın sözünә baxmaq istәmәdi, onu rәdd etdi vә Misirә qayıtmağı arzuladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods that will go before us, for as for this Moses, who led us out of the land of Egypt, we don't know what has become of him.’

block.text: Haruna dedilәr: “Bizim üçün allahlar düzәlt ki, qabağımızca getsinlәr. Çünki bizi Misir torpağından çıxaran adamın – bu Musanın başına nә iş gәldiyini bilmirik!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

block.text: O günlәrdә dana şәklindә bir büt düzәldib ona qurban gәtirdilәr vә öz әllәri ilә düzәltdiklәri bu büt üçün şәnlik qurdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God turned, and gave them up to serve the army of the sky, as it is written in the book of the prophets, ‘Did you offer to me slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

block.text: Buna görә Allah ata-babalarımızdan üz döndәrib onları tәrk etdi ki, sәma cisimlәrinә ibadәt etsinlәr. Peyğәmbәrlәrin kitabında da belә yazılıb: “Ey İsrail nәsli, Qırx il çöldә olanda Mәnә qurban vә tәqdimlәr gәtirmişdinizmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You took up the tabernacle of Moloch, the star of your god Rephan, the figures which you made to worship. I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’”

block.text: Sәcdә edәsiniz deyә düzәltdiyiniz Molekin çadırını, Tanrınız Refanın ulduz bütünü gәzdirdiniz. Elә buna görә dә sizi Babilin o tayına sürgünә aparacağam”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of the testimony in the wilderness, even as he who spoke to Moses commanded him to make it according to the pattern that he had seen.

block.text: Sәhrada ata-babalarınızın Şәhadәt çadırı var idi. Musa bunu onunla danışan Allahın әmr etdiyi kimi, gördüyü nümunәyә әsasәn düzәltmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having received the tabernacle, our fathers, under Joshua, brought it with them when they entered into the possession of the nations, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers, to the days of David.

block.text: Şәhadәt çadırını әvvәlki nәsildәn tәhvil alan ata-babalarımız Yeşuanın başçılığı ilә başqa millәtlәrin mülkünü әlә keçirәndә çadırı da özlәri ilә gәtirmişdilәr. Allah Özü millәtlәri ata-babalarımızın qarşısından qovdu. Şәhadәt çadırı Davudun dövrünә qәdәr qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: David found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.

block.text: Allahın lütfünü qazanan Davud yalvardı ki, Yaqubun nәsli üçün bir mәskәn qura bilsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Solomon built him a house.

block.text: Lakin Allaha ev tikәn Süleyman oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, the Most High doesn't dwell in temples made with hands: The prophet says:

block.text: Amma Haqq-Taala әllә tikilәn evlәrdә yaşamaz. Peyğәmbәrin dediyi kimi Rәbb belә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘heaven is my throne, and the earth a footstool for my feet. What kind of house will you build me?’ says the Lord; ‘or what is the place of my rest?

block.text: “Göylәr Mәnim taxtımdır, Yer ayaqlarımın altındakı kәtildir. Mәnim üçün nә cür ev tikәcәksiniz, Dincәlәcәyim yer harada olacaq?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn't my hand make all these things?’”

block.text: Bütün bunları Mәnim әlim yaratmadımı?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, you always resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so you do.

block.text: Ey dikbaş, hәm ürәklәri, hәm dә qulaqları “sünnәt” edilmәmiş insanlar, ata-babanız kimi siz dә hәmişә Müqәddәs Ruhun әleyhinә çıxırsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of the prophets didn't your fathers persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One, of whom you have now become betrayers and murderers.

block.text: Ata-babalarınızın tәqib etmәdiyi peyğәmbәr varmı? Onlar Saleh Olanın zühuru barәdә әvvәlcәdәn xәbәr verәnlәri belә, öldürdülәr. Sizsә bu Saleh Olana xәyanәt edәrәk Onu qәtlә yetirdiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You received the law as it was ordained by angels, and didn't keep it!”

block.text: Mәlәklәr vasitәsilә verilәn Qanunu aldınız, lakin ona riayәt etmәdiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.

block.text: Ali Şuranın üzvlәri bu sözlәri eşidәndә çox qәzәblәndilәr vә Stefana dişlәrini qıcıtdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked up steadfastly into heaven, and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing on the right hand of God,
and said,

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruhla dolan Stefan isә gözlәrini göyә dikib Allahın ehtişamını vә Allahın sağında dayanan İsanı gördü.
O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I see the heavens opened, and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”

block.text: <<Baxın, mәn göylәrin yarıldığını vә Bәşәr Oğlunun Allahın sağında dayandığını görürәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they cried out with a loud voice, and stopped their ears, and rushed at him with one accord.

block.text: Onlar qulaqlarını tutub haray qopardılar vә hamısı birlikdә Stefanın üstünә hücum çәkdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the city, and stoned him. The witnesses placed their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

block.text: Onu şәhәrdәn kәnara çıxarıb daşqalaq etdilәr. Stefanın әleyhinә şahidlik edәnlәr öz üst geyimlәrini Şaul adlı bir gәncin ayaqları altına qoydular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stoned Stephen as he called out, saying,

block.text: Stefan üstünә yağan daşlar altında belә yalvarırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb İsa, ruhumu qәbul et>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He kneeled down, and cried with a loud voice,

block.text: Sonra diz çöküb bәrkdәn nida etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't hold this sin against them!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bunu onlara günah sayma>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he fell asleep.

block.text: Bunu deyәndәn sonra gözlәrini bu hәyata yumdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 8

Saul was consenting to his death. A great persecution arose against the assembly which was in Jerusalem in that day. They were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except for the apostles.

block.text: Stefanın qәtlindәn Şaul da razı qalmışdı. O gün Yerusәlimdә olan imanlılar cәmiyyәtinә qarşı güclü tәqib başladı. Hәvarilәrdәn başqa bütün imanlılar pәrәn-pәrәn düşüb Yәhudeya vә Samariyanın hәr tәrәfinә yayıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Devout men buried Stephen, and lamented greatly over him.

block.text: Bәzi mömin kişilәr isә Stefanı dәfn etdi vә onun üçün dәrin hüznlә yas saxladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul ravaged the assembly, entering into every house, and dragged both men and women off to prison.

block.text: Amma Şaul imanlılar cәmiyyәtini dağıtmağa başladı. Belә ki o, evdәn-evә gedәrәk qadın-kişi bilmәdәn imanlıları sürüyüb zindana salırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore those who were scattered abroad went around preaching the word.

block.text: Pәrәn-pәrәn düşәn imanlılar hәr yerdә Allahın kәlamını – Müjdәni yayırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and proclaimed to them the Christ.

block.text: Filip dә Samariya şәhәrinә gәlib Mәsihi vәz edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitudes listened with one accord to the things that were spoken by Philip, when they heard and saw the signs which he did.

block.text: Filipi eşidib göstәrdiyi әlamәtlәri görәn izdiham onun sözlәrinә birlikdә diqqәt yetirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them. They came out, crying with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.

block.text: Natәmiz ruha tutulan çox adamdan bu ruhlar bәrkdәn çığıraraq çıxır, çox iflic vә ayaqları şikәst olanlar şәfa tapırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was great joy in that city.

block.text: Ona görә bu şәhәrdә bol sevinc var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there was a certain man, Simon by name, who used to practice sorcery in the city, and amazed the people of Samaria, making himself out to be some great one.

block.text: Amma bu şәhәrdә bundan әvvәl cadugәrlik edәn vә Samariya millәtini mat qoyan Şimon adlı bir kişi var idi. O özünü böyük bir şәxsiyyәt kimi tәqdim edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone listened to him, from the least to the greatest, saying,

block.text: Böyüklü-kiçikli hәr kәs ona diqqәtlә qulaq asır vә belә deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man is that great power of God.”

block.text: <<Böyük adlanan Allahın qüvvәsi budur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him, because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.

block.text: Onun cadugәrliyi hamını çoxdan mat qoymuşdu. Buna görә dә ona diqqәtlә qulaq asırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they believed Philip preaching good news concerning the Kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

block.text: Amma Filip Allahın Padşahlığı vә İsa Mәsihin adı ilә bağlı Müjdәni yayanda sözlәrinә iman gәtirdilәr vә kişilәr dә, qadınlar da vәftiz oldular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon himself also believed. Being baptized, he continued with Philip. Seeing signs and great miracles occurring, he was amazed.

block.text: Şimon özü dә iman gәtirdi. Vәftiz olduqdan sonra Filipin yanından ayrılmadı. Göstәrilәn әlamәt vә möcüzәlәr Şimonu mat qoydu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

block.text: Yerusәlimdә qalan hәvarilәr Samariyalıların Allahın kәlamını qәbul etdiklәrini eşidәndә Peterlә Yәhyanı onların yanına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they arrived, they prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Peterlә Yәhya oraya çatanda dua etdi ki, Samariyalı imanlılar Müqәddәs Ruhu alsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He had not yet fallen on none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of Christ Jesus.

block.text: Çünki Ruh hәlә onların heç birinin üzәrinә enmәmişdi, sadәcә olaraq Rәbb İsanın adı ilә vәftiz olmuşdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Sonra Peterlә Yәhya әllәrini onların üstünә qoydu vә onlar Müqәddәs Ruhu aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money,
saying,
