block.text: Hәvarilәrin әl qoyması ilә Ruhun verildiyini görәn Şimon onlara pul tәklif edәrәk
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me also this power, that whomever I lay my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: <<Mәnә dә belә bir sәlahiyyәt verin. Әlimi kimin üstünә qoysam, Müqәddәs Ruhu alsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said to him,

block.text: Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could obtain the gift of God with money!

block.text: <<Pulun da yox olsun, sәn dә! Ona görә ki sәn Allahın әnamını pulla әldә edә bilmәk xәyalına düşmüsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have neither part nor lot in this matter, for your heart isn't right before God.

block.text: Bu işdә sәnin nә haqqın var, nә payın. Çünki Allahın qarşısında ürәyin düz deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Repent therefore of this, your wickedness, and ask God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.

block.text: Bu pisliyin üçün tövbә et, Rәbbә yalvar. Bәlkә ürәyinin bu niyyәti bağışlanar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and in the bondage of iniquity.”

block.text: Görürәm ki, sәndә acı zәhәr var vә haqsızlığın әsirisәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Şimon ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Pray for me to the Lord, that none of the things which you have spoken happen to me.”

block.text: <<Mәnim üçün Rәbbә siz yalvarın ki, dediklәrinizin heç biri mәnim başıma gәlmәsin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore, when they had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the Good News to many villages of the Samaritans.

block.text: Peterlә Yәhya şәhadәt edib Rәbbin kәlamını söylәyәndәn sonra Samariyalıların yaşadığı xeyli kәndlәrdә Müjdәni yaya-yaya Yerusәlimә qayıdırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying,

block.text: Bu zaman Rәbbin bir mәlәyi Filipә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go toward the south to the way that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza. This is a desert.”

block.text: <<Dur, cәnuba tәrәf, Yerusәlimdәn Qәzzәyә düşәn yola – sәhra yoluna çıx>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

block.text: Filip qalxıb getdi. Yolda Hәbәşli bir hәrәmağası ilә rastlaşdı. Bu, kandakinin, yәni Hәbәşlilәrin mәlәkәsinin vәzirlәrindәn biri idi. O, mәlәkәnin bütün xәzinәsinә cavabdeh idi. Yerusәlimә ibadәt etmәk üçün gәlmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was returning and sitting in his chariot, and was reading the prophet Isaiah.
The Spirit said to Philip,

block.text: Arabasına oturub geri qayıdarkәn Yeşaya peyğәmbәrin kitabını oxuyurdu.
Ruh Filipә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go near, and join yourself to this chariot.”

block.text: <<Get, bu arabaya çatıb yanında qal>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip ran to him, and heard him reading Isaiah the prophet, and said,

block.text: Filip qaça-qaça arabanın yanına gәldi vә eşitdi ki, hәrәmağası Yeşaya peyğәmbәrin kitabını oxuyur. Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you understand what you are reading?”

block.text: <<Görәsәn oxuduğunu başa düşürsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Hәrәmağası ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can I, unless someone explains it to me?”

block.text: <<Әgәr mәnә yol göstәrәn yoxdursa, bunu necә başa düşmәk olar?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He begged Philip to come up and sit with him.

block.text: Sonra Filipdәn xahiş etdi ki, arabaya minib onun yanında otursun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the passage of the Scripture which he was reading was this,

block.text: O, Müqәddәs Yazılardan bu hissәni oxuyurdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter. As a lamb before his shearer is silent, so he doesn't open his mouth.

block.text: <<Kәsilmәyә aparılan qoyun kimi, Qırxanların qabağında dilsiz quzu kimi Ağzını açmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his humiliation, his judgment was taken away. Who will declare His generation? For his life is taken from the earth.”

block.text: Alçaldığı zaman әdalәtdәn mәhrum oldu. Onun nәslini kim tәsvir edә bilәr? Onun hәyatı yer üzündәn götürülür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The eunuch answered Philip,

block.text: Hәrәmağası Filipdәn soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is the prophet talking about? About himself, or about someone else?”

block.text: <<Xahiş edirәm, deyin, burada peyğәmbәr kimdәn bәhs edir, özündәn, yoxsa başqasından?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip opened his mouth, and beginning from this Scripture, preached to him Jesus.

block.text: Bundan sonra Filip sözә başlayıb danışdı vә Müqәddәs Yazıların bu hissәsindәn başlayıb İsa barәdә olan Müjdәni bәyan etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went on the way, they came to some water, and the eunuch said,

block.text: Onlar yol gedә-gedә gәlib su olan yerә çatdılar. Hәrәmağası dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, here is water. What is keeping me from being baptized?”

block.text: <<Burada su var. Mәnim vәftiz olmağıma nә isә mane olurmu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And Philip said,

block.text: And Philip said:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you believe with all your heart, you may”.

block.text: <<If you believe with all your heart, you may.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he answered and said,

block.text: And he answered and said:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God”.

block.text: <<I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the chariot to stand still, and they both went down into the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.

block.text: Sonra әmr etdi ki, araba dayansın. Filip hәrәmağası ilә birgә suya girdi. Belәliklә, Filip hәrәmağasını vәftiz etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, and the eunuch didn't see him any more, for he went on his way rejoicing.

block.text: Sudan çıxanda Rәbbin Ruhu Filipi götürüb oradan uzaqlaşdırdı. Filipi bir daha görmәyәn hәrәmağası sevinә-sevinә yoluna davam etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Philip was found at Azotus. Passing through, he preached the Good News to all the cities, until he came to Caesarea.

block.text: Filip bir dә gördü ki, Aşdod şәhәrinә gәlib-çıxıb. O, Qeysәriyyәyә çatanacan bütün şәhәrlәri gәzib-dolaşaraq Müjdәni yaydı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 9
But Saul was still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord.

block.text: Şaul Rәbbin şagirdlәrinә qarşı hәlә dә ölüm hәdәlәri yağdırırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went to the high priest,
and asked for letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

block.text: Baş kahinin yanına gedib
ondan Dәmәşq sinaqoqlarına yazılan mәktublar istәdi ki, orada İsa yolunu tutan kişi vә qadınlardan kimi tapsa, әl-qolunu bağlayıb Yerusәlimә gәtirmәk üçün sәlahiyyәti olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he traveled, it happened that he got close to Damascus, and suddenly a light from the sky shone around him.

block.text: Dәmәşqә yollanıb oraya yaxınlaşanda birdәn göydәn gәlәn bir işıq onun әtrafında parladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He fell on the earth, and heard a voice saying to him,

block.text: Şaul yerә yıxıldı vә bir sәs eşitdi, ona deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me?”

block.text: <<Şaul, Şaul, niyә Mәni tәqib edirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Şaul ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you, Lord?”

block.text: <<Ey Ağam, Sәn kimsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: O cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting: it is hard for you to kick against the goads.”

block.text: <<Mәn sәnin tәqib etdiyin İsayam. Çətindir siz goads qarşı salmaq üçün vacibdir."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he trembling and astonished said,

block.text: Şaul ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what should I do?”

block.text: <<What must I do? >>

ReferenceBlocks.text: And the Lord said to him,

block.text: Rәbb ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise up, and enter into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

block.text: Qalx ayağa, şәhәrә get vә nә etmәk lazımdırsa, sәnә deyilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men who traveled with him stood speechless, hearing the sound, but seeing no one.

block.text: Şaulla birlikdә yola çıxan adamlar yerlәrindәcә susub qalmışdı. Sәsi eşitsәlәr dә, heç kimi görә bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened, he saw no one. They led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

block.text: Şaul yerdәn qalxdı, amma gözlәrini açanda heç nә görә bilmirdi. Sonra onun әlindәn tutub Dәmәşqә apardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was without sight for three days, and neither ate nor drank.

block.text: Üç gün әrzindә Şaulun gözlәri görmәdi vә o nә yedi, nә dә içdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision,

block.text: Dәmәşqdә İsanın şagirdlәrindәn Xananya adlı bir nәfәr var idi. Rәbb görüntü vasitәsilә deyә çağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ananias!”

block.text: <<Xananya!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: O cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, it's me, Lord.”

block.text: <<Bәli, ya Rәbb!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him,

block.text: Rәbb ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judah for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus. For behold, he is praying.

block.text: <<Qalx, “Düz Küçә” adlanan küçәyә get vә Yәhudanın evindә adı Şaul olan Tarsuslu bir adamı soruş. Hal-hazırda orada dua edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.”

block.text: O, görüntüdә görüb ki, yanına Xananya adlı bir kişi gәlib onun üzәrinә әllәrini qoyur ki, gözlәri açılsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Ananias answered,

block.text: Xananya cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much evil he did to your saints at Jerusalem.

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bu kişi barәdә çoxlarından eşitmişәm ki, Yerusәlimdә Sәnin müqәddәslәrinә nә qәdәr pislik edib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on your name.”

block.text: Burada Sәnin adını çәkәnlәrin hәr birinin әl-qolunu bağlamaq üçün başçı kahinlәrdәn sәlahiyyәt alıb>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Lord said to him,

block.text: Amma Rәbb ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way, for he is my chosen vessel to bear my name before the nations and kings, and the children of Israel.

block.text: <<Get! Başqa millәtlәrә, padşahlara vә İsrail övladlarına Öz adımı bәyan elәmәk üçün bu adam seçdiyim alәtdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name's sake.”

block.text: Mәnim adım uğrunda çәkәcәyi әzabın nә qәdәr böyük olduğunu ona göstәrәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ananias departed, and entered into the house. Laying his hands on him, he said,

block.text: Bundan sonra Xananya gedib hәmin evә girdi vә әllәrini Şaulun üstünә qoyub dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brother Saul, the Lord, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me, that you may receive your sight, and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: <<Qardaşım Şaul, Rәbb, yәni bura gәlәrkәn yolda sәnә görünәn İsa mәni göndәrdi ki, sәnin gözlәrin açılsın vә Müqәddәs Ruhla dolasan>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes, and he received his sight. He arose and was baptized.

block.text: O andaca Şaulun gözlәrindәn sanki pulcuqlar töküldü vә Şaul tәkrar görmәyә başladı. O qalxdı vә vәftiz oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took food and was strengthened. Saul stayed several days with the disciples who were at Damascus.

block.text: Sonra yemәk yeyib taqәtә gәldi. Bir neçә gün Şaul Dәmәşqdә olan şagirdlәrin yanında qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately in the synagogues he proclaimed the Christ, that he is the Son of God.

block.text: Dәrhal sinaqoqlarda İsanın Allahın Oğlu olduğunu vәz etmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All who heard him were amazed, and said,

block.text: Onu eşidәnlәrin hamısı mat qalıb deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this he who in Jerusalem made havoc of those who called on this name? And he had come here intending to bring them bound before the chief priests!”

block.text: <<Yerusәlimdә bu adı çәkәnlәri dağıdan adam bu deyilmi? Buraya belәlәrini әl-qolunu bağlayıb başçı kahinlәrin yanına aparmağa gәlmәmişdimi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul increased more in strength, and confounded the Jews who lived at Damascus, proving that this is the Christ.

block.text: Şaul isә gündәn-günә qüvvәtlәnirdi. İsanın Mәsih olmasına dair sübutlar göstәrmәklә Dәmәşqdә yaşayan Yәhudilәri çaş-baş saldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When many days were fulfilled, the Jews conspired together to kill him.

block.text: Aradan xeyli gün keçdi. Yәhudilәr Şaulu öldürmәk üçün sui-qәsd hazırladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, their plot became known to Saul. They watched the gates both day and night that they might kill him.

block.text: Amma onların bu qәsdi haqqında xәbәr Şaula çatdı. Yәhudilәr onu öldürmәk üçün gecә-gündüz şәhәrin qapılarında pusqu qururdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore, his disciples took him by night, and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket.

block.text: Amma Şaulun şagirdlәri gecә olan kimi onu götürüb bir sәbәtin içinә qoyaraq şәhәr divarlarından aşağı endirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join himself to the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

block.text: Şaul Yerusәlimә çatanda oradakı şagirdlәrә qoşulmağa çalışdı, lakin onların hamısı Şauldan qorxur vә inanmırdılar ki, o, İsanın şagirdidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and declared to them:

block.text: Lakin Barnaba onu götürdü və havarilerin onu gətirilmiş və onlara bəyan:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saw and spoke to the Lord while he was on the road, and he preached boldly at Damascas in the Name of the Lord.”

block.text: "O, gördü və o yolda olarkən Rəbbi üçün danışdı və o abırsız olan Rəbbinin adı Damascas edilib təbliğ".

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with them entering into Jerusalem.

block.text: Belәliklә, Şaul onların yanında qalıb Yerusәlimdә hәr yerә bir gedib-gәlir vә orada da Rәbbin adını cәsarәtlә bәyan edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He preached boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus. He spoke and disputed against the Hellenists, but they were seeking to kill him.

block.text: O yunanca danışan Yәhudilәrlә söhbәt edәrәk mübahisә edirdi. Onlar isә Şaulu öldürmәk istәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the brothers knew it, they brought him down to Caesarea, and sent him off to Tarsus.

block.text: İmanlı bacı-qardaşlar isә bunu öyrәnәndә Şaulu Qeysәriyyәyә aparıb oradan Tarsusa göndәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the assemblies throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, and were built up. They were multiplied, walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Belәcә bütün Yәhudeya, Qalileya vә Samariyadakı imanlılar cәmiyyәti әmin-amanlığa çatdı. İnkişaf edәn vә Rәbb qorxusu içindә yaşayan cәmiyyәt Müqәddәs Ruhun ürәklәndirmәsi ilә sayca artırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as Peter went throughout all those parts, he came down also to the saints who lived at Lydda.

block.text: Bu zaman hәr yanı dolaşan Peter Lodda yaşayan müqәddәslәrin yanına gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years, because he was paralyzed.
Peter said to him,

block.text: Orada Eneya adlı bir nәfәrә baş çәkdi. Eneya iflic olmuşdu vә sәkkiz il idi ki, yataqda idi.
Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Take up your mat and get up.!”

block.text: <<Eneya, İsa Mәsih sәni sağaldır. Qalx, yatağını yığışdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he arose.
All who lived at Lydda and in Sharon saw him, and they turned to the Lord.

block.text: Eneya dәrhal ayağa qalxdı.
Lod vә Şaronda yaşayanların hamısı bu adamı görüb Rәbbә tәrәf döndü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, which when translated, means Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and acts of mercy which she did.

block.text: Yafoda İsanın şagirdlәri arasında Tabita adlı bir qadın var idi. <<Tabita>><<Ceyran>> demәkdir. Bu qadın hәmişә xeyirxah işlәr görür vә yoxsullara kömәk edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in those days that she fell sick, and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.

block.text: Bu vaxtlarda o xәstәlәnib öldü. Onun meyitini yuyub yuxarı mәrtәbәdәki otağa qoydular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, hearing that Peter was there, sent two men to him, imploring him

block.text: Lod Yafoya yaxın idi, ona görә dә Peterin Lodda olduğunu eşidәn şagirdlәr iki kişini onun yanına göndәrdilәr vә onlar gәlib xahiş etdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not to delay in coming.”

block.text: <<Vaxt itirmәdәn yanımıza gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter got up and went with them. When he had come, they brought him into the upper room. All the widows stood by him weeping, and showing the coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.

block.text: Peter durub onlarla getdi. Yafoya çatanda onlar Peteri evin yuxarı mәrtәbәsinә çıxartdılar. Bütün dul qadınlar ağlaşa-ağlaşa Peterin yanına yığıldı vә Tabitanın onlarla birlikdә olanda tikdiyi köynәklәri, paltarları göstәrirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter put them all out, and kneeled down and prayed. Turning to the body, he said,

block.text: Peter isә onların hamısını bayıra çıxartdı, sonra diz çöküb dua etdi. Bundan sonra isә ölüyә tәrәf dönüb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tabitha, get up!”

block.text: <<Tabita, qalx!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.

block.text: Qadın gözlәrini açıb Peteri görәn kimi dik oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gave her his hand, and raised her up. Calling the saints and widows, he presented her alive.

block.text: Peter әlini uzadıb onu ayağa qaldırdı vә sonra müqәddәslәrlә dul qadınları çağırdı. Tabitanı sağ-salamat onların qarşısına çıxartdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.

block.text: Bu xәbәr bütün Yafoya yayıldı vә çox adam Rәbbә iman gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that he stayed many days in Joppa with one Simon, a tanner.

block.text: Peter isә xeyli gün Yafoda, Şimon adlı bir dabbağın evindә qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 10
Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, Cornelius by name, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment.

block.text: Qeysәriyyәdә Korneli adlı bir nәfәr yaşayırdı. O, İtaliyalı adlı alayın yüzbaşılarından biri idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was a devout man, and one who feared God with all his house, who gave gifts for the needy generously to the people, and always prayed to God.

block.text: Hәm özü, hәm dә bütün külfәti mömin olub Allahdan qorxardı. O, xalqa çox nәzir-niyaz paylayar, daim Allaha dua edәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At about the ninth hour of the day, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God coming to him, and saying to him,

block.text: Bir gün tәxminәn doqquzuncu saat radәlәrindә görüntüdә aydın gördü ki, Allahın bir mәlәyi yanına gәlib onu çağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cornelius!”

block.text: <<Ey Korneli!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, fastening his eyes on him, and being frightened, said,

block.text: Korneli qorxa-qorxa ona baxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is it, Lord?”

block.text: <<Nәdir, ey ağam?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Mәlәk ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your prayers and your gifts to the needy have gone up for a memorial before God.

block.text: <<Duaların vә nәzir-niyazların xatirә tәqdimi kimi Allahın hüzurunda qәbul olundu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now send men to Joppa, and get Simon, who is surnamed Peter.

block.text: İndi Yafoya adamlar göndәr, Peter adlanan Şimonu çağırtdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lodges with one Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the seaside: he will tell you what you should do..”

block.text: O, dabbağ Şimonun dәniz kәnarındakı evindә qonaqdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier of those who waited on him continually.

block.text: Onunla danışan mәlәk gedәndәn sonra Korneli xidmәtçilәrindәn ikisini vә mühafizәçilәrindәn bir mömin әsgәri çağırtdırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.

block.text: Onlara hәr şeyi danışdı vә sonra onları Yafoya göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the next day as they were on their journey, and got close to the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray at about noon.

block.text: Ertәsi gün tәxminәn altıncı saat radәlәrindә, onlar yolda olub şәhәrә yaxınlaşanda Peter dua etmәk üçün dama çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He became hungry and desired to eat, but while they were preparing, he fell into a trance.

block.text: O acıb yemәk istәyirdi. Yemәk hazırlanarkәn Peterin fikrini bir görüntü apardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw heaven opened and a certain container descending to him, like a great sheet let down by four corners on the earth.

block.text: O gördü ki, göy yarıldı, böyük mәlәfәyә bәnzәr bir şey dörd küncündәn asılaraq yerә endi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the sheet were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, reptiles, and birds of the sky.
A voice came to him,

block.text: Onun üstündә hәr cür dördayaqlılar, sürünәnlәr vә göydә uçan quşlar var idi.
Ona bir sәda gәldi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rise, Peter, kill and eat!”

block.text: <<Qalx, Peter, kәs vә ye!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said,

block.text: Peter Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.”

block.text: <<Әsla, ya Rәbb! Mәn heç vaxt nә haram, nә dә murdar bir şey yemişәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came to him again the second time,

block.text: Sәda ikinci dәfә yenә gәldi vә Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.”

block.text: <<Allahın halal dediyi şeylәrә sәn haram demә>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and immediately the vessel was received up into heaven.

block.text: Bu, üç dәfә tәkrarlanandan sonra o şey dәrhal göyә çәkildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter was very perplexed and he wondered:

block.text: İndi çox çaşqın, Peter idi və o merak:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this vision mean?”

block.text: "Bu vision anlamı nedir?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Meanwhile, the men who were sent by Cornelius, were looking for Simon's house, and were now standing at the gate.
They called out and asked:

block.text: Bu arada, kim Cornelius tərəfindən göndərilmiş kişilər, Simon evi üçün və aradığınız artıq darvazanın ağzında duran idi.
bәrkdәn soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is Simon, who is surnamed Peter lodging here?”

block.text: <<Peter deyә çağırılan Şimon burada qalırmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him,

block.text: Bu zaman görüntü barәdә fikirlәşәn Peterә Ruh belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, three men seek you.
Arise, go down and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”

block.text: <<Bax sәni üç kişi axtarır.
Dur, aşağı en vә heç tәrәddüd etmәdәn onlarla get. Çünki onları Mәn göndәrmişәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter went down to the men, and said,

block.text: Peter aşağı enib hәmin adamlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?”

block.text: <<Axtardığınız adam mәnәm. Niyә gәlmisiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We were sent by Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man and one who fears God, and well spoken of by all the nation of the Jews. He was directed by a holy angel to invite you to his house, and to listen to what you say.”

block.text: <<Korneli adlı bir yüzbaşı var. O, saleh vә Allahdan qorxan kişidir; buna bütün Yәhudi millәti dә şahiddir. Müqәddәs bir mәlәk ona әmr etdi ki, sәni öz evinә çağırtdırsın vә deyәcәyin sözlәrә qulaq assın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he called them in and lodged them.

block.text: Bundan sonra Peter onları içәri dәvәt edib qonaq saxladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day Peter arose and went out with them, and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.

block.text: Ertәsi gün Peter qalxıb onlarla yola çıxdı vә Yafodan olan bәzi qardaşlar da onlara qoşuldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day they entered into Caesarea. Cornelius was waiting for them, having called together his relatives and his near friends.

block.text: Sonrakı gün Qeysәriyyәyә çatdı. Korneli öz qohumlarını vә yaxın dostlarını bir yerә yığıb onları gözlәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell down at his feet, and worshiped him.

block.text: Peter içәri girәndә Korneli ayağına düşüb ona sәcdә etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter raised him up, saying,

block.text: Peter isә onu ayağa qaldıraraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up! I myself am also a man.”

block.text: <<Qalx, mәn dә sәnin kimi insanam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he talked with him, he went in and found many gathered together.
He said to them,

block.text: Peter Korneli ilә danışa-danışa içәri daxil olanda gördü ki, oraya xeyli adam yığılıb.
Onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You yourselves know how it is an unlawful thing for a man who is a Jew to join himself or come to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I shouldn't call any man unholy or unclean.

block.text: <<Bilirsiniz ki, Yәhudilәrә hәr hansı bir yadelli ilә ünsiyyәt yaratmaq, onlara qonaq getmәk qadağandır. Amma insanları haram vә murdar saymamağı Allah mәnә göstәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore also I came without complaint when I was sent for. I ask therefore, why did you send for me?”

block.text: Buna görә mәni çağıranda etiraz etmәdәn gәldim. Deyә bilәrsinizmi, mәni niyә çağırmısınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Cornelius said,

block.text: Korneli cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

block.text: <<Üç gün әvvәl elә bu vaxtlarda doqquzuncu saatın duasını edirdim ki, birdәn parlaq libaslı bir kişi qarşımda dayandı

ReferenceBlocks.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer is heard, and your gifts to the needy are remembered in the sight of God.

block.text: vә dedi: “Ey Korneli, sәnin duaların eşidildi vә nәzir-niyazların Allah tәrәfindәn yada salındı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Send therefore to Joppa, and summon Simon, who is surnamed Peter. He lodges in the house of Simon a tanner, by the seaside. When he comes, he will speak to you.’

block.text: İndi Yafoya adamlar göndәr, Peter adlanan Şimonu çağırtdır. O, dabbağ Şimonun dәniz kәnarındakı evindә qonaqdır”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I sent to you at once, and it was good of you to come. Now therefore we are all here present in the sight of God to hear all things that have been commanded you by God.”

block.text: Ona görә sәnin yanına adamlar göndәrdim vә sәn dә xeyirxahlıq göstәrәrәk gәldin. İndi hamımız Allahın önündәyik vә Rәbbin sәnә әmr etdiyi hәr sözә qulaq asmağa hazırıq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter opened his mouth and said,

block.text: Peter sözә başlayıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I perceive that God doesn't show favoritism;

block.text: <<İndi bildim ki, hәqiqәtәn, Allah tәrәfkeşlik etmir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in every nation he who fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him.

block.text: Milliyәtindәn asılı olmayaraq kim ki Ondan qorxub әmәlisaleh olarsa, Ona mәqbuldur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, preaching good news of peace by Jesus Christ--he is Lord of all—

block.text: O, İsrail övladlarına Öz kәlamını göndәrdi vә hamının Sahibi olan İsa Mәsih vasitәsilә barışdırma Müjdәsini yaydı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you know what happened, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism which John preached;

block.text: Bilirsiniz ki, Yәhyanın vәftiz üçün çağırışından sonra Qalileyadan başlayaraq bütün Yәhudeyada nәlәr baş verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: even Jesus of Nazareth, how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power. He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with him.

block.text: Allah Nazaretli İsanı Müqәddәs Ruhla vә qüdrәtlә mәsh etdi. İsa xeyirxahlıq edәrәk hәr yanı gәzib iblisin tәzyiqinә mәruz qalanların hamısını sağaltdı. Çünki Allah Ona yar idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We are witnesses of everything he did both in the country of the Jews, and in Jerusalem; whom they also killed, hanging him on a tree.

block.text: Yәhudilәrin ölkәsindә vә Yerusәlimdә İsanın nәlәr etdiyinin şahidi olduq. Onu çarmıxa çәkib öldürdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God raised him up the third day, and caused him to be seen.

block.text: God raised him up the third day, and caused him to be seen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen -- by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

block.text: He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen -- by us, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that this is he who is appointed by God as the Judge of the living and the dead.

block.text: Bizә isә әmr verdi ki, “Allahın tәyin etdiyi ölülәrlә dirilәrin Hakimi Budur” deyә bunu xalqa şәhadәt etmәklә vәz edәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the prophets testify about him, that through his name everyone who believes in him will receive remission of sins.”

block.text: Onun barәsindә bütün peyğәmbәrlәr şәhadәt edir ki, Ona iman edәn hәr kәsin günahı Onun adı ilә bağışlanır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the word.

block.text: Peter bu sözlәri deyirdi ki, Müqәddәs Ruh söhbәtә qulaq asan hәr kәsin üzәrinә endi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They of the circumcision who believed were amazed, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also poured out on the Gentiles.

block.text: Peterlә birlikdә gәlmiş sünnәtli imanlılar Müqәddәs Ruhun bәxşiş olaraq başqa millәtlәrin dә üstünә töküldüyünә mat qaldı;

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they heard them speaking in other languages and magnifying God. Then Peter answered,

block.text: onların başqa dillәrdә danışıb Allahı mәdh etdiyini eşitdilәr. Onda Peter belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can any man forbid the water, that these who have received the Holy Spirit as well as we should not be baptized?”

block.text: <<Bu adamlar bizim kimi Müqәddәs Ruhu alıb. Bunların su ilә vәftiz olmalarına kim mane ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay some days.

block.text: Belәliklә, onların İsa Mәsihin adı ilә vәftiz olmalarını buyurdu. Sonra onlar Peterdәn xahiş etdilәr ki, bir neçә gün onların yanında qalsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 11
Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

block.text: Hәvarilәrlә bütün Yәhudeyadakı imanlı bacı-qardaşlar eşitdi ki, başqa millәtlәr dә Allahın kәlamını qәbul ediblәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,
saying,

block.text: Peter Yerusәlimә gәlәndә sünnәt tәrәfdarları onu tәnqid edәrәk
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”

block.text: <<Sәn sünnәtsizlәrin evinә gedib onlarla birgә yemәk yemisәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter began, and explained to them in order, saying,

block.text: Peter sözә başlayıb onlara hәr şeyi bir-bir izah etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision: I saw something like a large sheet let down from heaven by four corners. It came down to where I was.

block.text: <<Mәn Yafo şәhәrindә dua edirdim. Birdәn fikrimi görüntü apardı. Gördüm ki, böyük mәlәfәyә bәnzәr bir şey dörd küncündәn asılaraq göydәn enib mәnim yanıma çatır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I had looked intently at it, I considered, and saw the four-footed animals of the earth, wild animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky.

block.text: Bu şeyә gözlәrimi dikib diqqәtlә baxdım. Gördüm ki, onun üstündә yer üzәrindә yaşayan dördayaqlılar, çöl heyvanları, sürünәnlәr vә göydә uçan quşlar var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter, kill and eat!’

block.text: Sonra eşitdim ki, bir sәda mәnә deyir: “Qalx, Peter, kәs vә ye!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord, for nothing unholy or unclean has ever entered into my mouth.’

block.text: Mәn dedim: “Әsla, ya Rәbb! Heç vaxt mәnim ağzıma nә haram, nә dә murdar bir şey dәyib”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, ‘What God has cleansed, don't you call unclean.’

block.text: Yenә göydәn sәda gәldi: “Allahın halal dediyi şeylәrә sәn haram demә”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.

block.text: Bu, üç dәfә tәkrarlanandan sonra hәr şey yenә göyә çәkildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, immediately three men stood before the house where I was, having been sent from Caesarea to me.

block.text: Elә bu zaman Qeysәriyyәdәn mәnim yanıma göndәrilәn üç kişi qaldığımız evin qapısında dayandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Spirit told me to go with them, without discriminating. These six brothers also accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house.

block.text: Ruh mәnә dedi ki, tәrәddüd etmәdәn onlarla gedim. İmanlı qardaşlarımız olan bu altı nәfәr dә mәnә qoşulub hәmin kişinin evinә girdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house, and saying to him, ‘Send to Joppa, and get Simon, whose surname is Peter.

block.text: Bu adam bizә nәql etdi ki, öz evindә dayanan mәlәk görüb. Mәlәk ona demişdi: “Yafoya adamlar göndәr, Peter adlanan Şimonu çağırtdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will speak to you words by which you will be saved, you and all your house.’

block.text: Onun sәnә deyәcәyi sözlәrlә hәm sәn, hәm dә bütün külfәtin xilas olacaq”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, even as on us at the beginning.

block.text: Mәn sözә başlayanda Müqәddәs Ruh başlanğıcda bizim üstümüzә endiyi kimi onların da üstünә endi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John indeed baptized in water, but you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’

block.text: Onda Rәbbin dediyi bu sözlәr yadıma düşdü: “Yәhya su ilә vәftiz etdi, amma siz Müqәddәs Ruhla vәftiz olacaqsınız”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If then God gave to them the same gift as us, when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I, that I could withstand God?”

block.text: Belәliklә, Rәbb İsa Mәsihә iman edәn bizlәrә verdiyi eyni bәxşişi Allah onlara da veribsә, mәn kimәm ki, Allaha qarşı çıxam?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard these things, they held their peace, and glorified God, saying,

block.text: Bu sözlәri eşidib hamı sakitlәşdi vә Allahı izzәtlәndirib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life!”

block.text: <<Demәli, Allah başqa millәtlәrә dә imkan yaratdı ki, tövbә edib hәyat tapsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They therefore who were scattered abroad by the oppression that arose about Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the word to no one except to Jews only.

block.text: Stefanın öldürülmәsi ilә başlanan tәqib nәticәsindә pәrәn-pәrәn düşәn imanlılar Finikiya, Kipr vә Antakyaya qәdәr getdi. Allahın kәlamını yalnız Yәhudilәrә dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.

block.text: Amma onların arasından bәzi Kiprli vә Kirenalılar Antakyaya gedib yunanca danışanlarla da söhbәtә başladılar. Onlara Rәbb İsa ilә bağlı Müjdәni yayırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.

block.text: Rәbbin әli onların üzәrindә idi vә bunun nәticәsindә xeyli insan iman gәtirib Rәbbә tәrәf döndü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report concerning them came to the ears of the assembly which was in Jerusalem. They sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.

block.text: Bunların xәbәri Yerusәlimdәki cәmiyyәtә çatdı vә Barnabanı Antakyaya göndәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come and had seen the grace of God, he was glad. He exhorted them all, that with purpose of heart they should remain near to the Lord.

block.text: O oraya çatanda Allahın lütfünün bәhrәsini görüb sevindi. O hamını hәvәslәndirirdi ki, cani-dildәn Rәbbә bağlı qalsınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was a good man, and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith, and many people were added to the Lord.

block.text: Çünki özü Müqәddәs Ruhla vә imanla dolu, xeyirxah bir kişi idi. Bunun nәticәsindә dә böyük bir kütlә Rәbbә iman gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas went out to Tarsus to look for Saul.

block.text: Sonra Barnaba Tarsusa gedib Şaulu axtardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

block.text: Onu tapan kimi Antakyaya gәtirdi. Bir il әrzindә oradakı imanlılar cәmiyyәtinә qoşulub bir yerdә yığılaraq böyük bir kütlәyә tәlim öyrәdirdi. Şagirdlәr ilk dәfә olaraq Antakyada mәsihçi adlandırıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in those days, prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

block.text: Elә hәmin günlәrdә Yerusәlimdәn Antakyaya bәzi peyğәmbәrlәr gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them named Agabus stood up. Being prompted by the Holy Spirit, he said:

block.text: Onlardan biri Agabus durdu adına. Müqəddəs Ruh tərəfindən verildikdən dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There will be a large famine all over the world.”

block.text: "Böyük bir aclıq bütün dünyada olacaq."

ReferenceBlocks.text: (This famine happened in the days of Claudius.)

block.text: Bu aclıq Klavdinin hakimiyyәti dövrünә tәsadüf olundu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Since the disciples had plenty, they each decided to send help to the brothers who lived in Judea;

block.text: Şagirdlәr qәrara aldı ki, hәr biri gücü çatan qәdәr Yәhudeyada yaşayan imanlı bacı-qardaşlarına yardım göndәrsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did this, sending it to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

block.text: Bu qәrara әmәl edәrәk yardımları Barnaba vә Şaulun әli ilә cәmiyyәt ağsaqqallarına göndәrdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 12
Now about that time, King Herod stretched out his hands to oppress some of the assembly.

block.text: O vaxtlar padşah Hirod cәmiyyәtin bәzi üzvlәrinә zülm etmәyә әl atdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

block.text: Yәhyanın qardaşı Yaqubu qılıncdan keçirib edam etdirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded to seize Peter also. This was during the days of unleavened bread.

block.text: Bundan Yәhudilәrin razı qaldığını görüb üstәlik Peteri dә tutdurdu. Bunu Mayasız Çörәk bayramı vaxtında etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of four soldiers each to guard him. He intended to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

block.text: O, Peteri yaxalatdırıb zindana saldırdı; onu hәr birindә dörd nәfәr olmaqla dörd әsgәri dәstәyә nәzarәt altında saxlanmaq üçün tәslim etdi. Niyyәtindә tutmuşdu ki, Pasxa bayramından sonra xalq qarşısında onun mәhkәmәsini keçirsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter therefore was kept in the prison, but constant prayer was made by the assembly to God for him.

block.text: Peter buna görә zindanda saxlanırdı. Lakin imanlılar cәmiyyәti ciddi-cәhdlә onun üçün Allaha dua edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The same night when Herod was about to bring him out, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, and was bound with two chains. Guards in front of the door kept the prison.

block.text: Peter Hirodun ona mәhkәmә quracağı günün әvvәlki gecәsi iki әsgәr arasında bir cüt zәncirә bağlanmış halda yatırdı. Qarovulçular da qapıda dayanıb zindanın tәhlükәsizliyini qoruyurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the cell. He struck Peter on the side, and woke him up, saying,

block.text: Qәflәtәn Rәbbin bir mәlәyi göründü. Zindanın otağı işıqlandı. Mәlәk Peterin böyrünә vurub onu oyatdı vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up quickly!”

block.text: <<Tez ol, qalx>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His chains fell off from his hands.

block.text: O andaca Peterin bilәklәrindәki zәncirlәr düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The angel said to him,

block.text: Mәlәk ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get dressed and put on your sandals.”

block.text: <<Qurşağını bağla, çarığını geyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He did so. He said to him,

block.text: Peter belә dә etdi. Mәlәk yenә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Put on your cloak, and follow me.”

block.text: <<Üst paltarını geyin, ardımca gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he went out and followed him. He didn't know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

block.text: Peter onun ardınca düşәrәk bayıra çıxdı. Amma mәlәyin etdiyinin hәqiqi olduğunu başa düşmürdü, elә bilirdi ki, bir görüntü görür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were past the first and the second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads into the city, which opened to them by itself. They went out, and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.

block.text: Birinci, ikinci qarovulçunun yanından keçәrәk şәhәrә açılan dәmir darvazaya çatdılar. Onlar çıxıb küçә uzunu getdi. Birdәn mәlәk Peterdәn ayrıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter had come to himself, he said,

block.text: O andaca özünә gәlәn Peter dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now I truly know that the Lord has sent out his angel and delivered me out of the hand of Herod, and from everything the Jewish people were expecting.”

block.text: <<İndi әminliklә başa düşdüm ki, Rәbb Öz mәlәyini göndәrib mәni Hirodun әlindәn vә Yәhudi xalqının gözlәdiyi bütün bәlalardan qurtardı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thinking about that, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together and were praying.

block.text: Peter bunları dәrk edәndә Mark adlanan Yәhyanın anası Mәryәmin evinә getdi. Orada xeyli adam yığılıb dua edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

block.text: Peter hәyәt qapısını döymәyә başladı vә Roda adlı bir qarabaş eşidib qapıya getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she recognized Peter's voice, she didn't open the gate for joy, but ran in, and reported that Peter was standing in front of the gate.
They said to her,

block.text: Qız Peteri sәsindәn tanıdı vә sevincindәn qapını belә, açmadan yenә evә qaçdı. Oradakılara xәbәr verdi ki, Peter qapıda dayanıb.
Onlar isә belә dedi:

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are crazy!”

block.text: <<Dәli olmusan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she insisted:

block.text: O, təkid:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is true… he is at the door!”

block.text: "Bu, doğru ... o qapını deyildir!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Belә olanda dedilәr:

block.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people praying at John Mark's mother's house
ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is his angel.”

block.text: <<Yәqin onu qoruyan mәlәkdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter continued knocking. When they had opened, they saw him, and were amazed.

block.text: Peter isә dayanmadan qapını döyürdü. Qapını açıb onu görәndә mat qaldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, beckoning to them with his hand to be silent, declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. He said,

block.text: Peter әli ilә susmaq işarәsi verәrәk Rәbbin onu necә zindandan çıxardığını nәql etdi. Sonra

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell these things to James, and to the brothers.”

block.text: <<bu xәbәri Yaquba vә o biri qardaşlara da çatdırın>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he departed, and went to another place.

block.text: deyәrәk onlardan ayrılıb başqa yerә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.

block.text: Sәhәr açılanda әsgәrlәri böyük bir vahimә bürüdü. Bir-birlәrindәn soruşdular: <<Bәs Peter necә oldu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Herod had sought for him, and didn't find him, he examined the guards, and commanded that they should be put to death. He went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.

block.text: Hirod onu axtartdırdı. Tapa bilmәyәndә isә qarovulçuları sorğu-suala çәkdirәndәn sonra edam edilmәlәrinә әmr verdi. Bundan sonra Hirod Yәhudeyadan Qeysәriyyәyә yollandı vә orada qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. They came with one accord to him, and, having befriended Blastus, the king's personal aide, they asked for peace because their country depended on the king's country for food.

block.text: Hirod Sur vә Sidon әhalisinә qarşı hiddәtindәn alışıb-yanırdı. Onlar birlikdә onun yanına gәlib sarayın mәişәt işlәri üzrә müdiri Blastı öz tәrәfinә çәkәrәk sülh istәdiklәrini bildirdilәr. Çünki onların ölkәsi padşahın ölkәsindәn gәlәn әrzaqdan asılı idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On an appointed day, Herod dressed himself in royal clothing, sat on the throne, and gave a speech to them.
The people shouted,

block.text: Tәyin olunan gündә şahlıq libasını geyәn Hirod hökm kürsüsünә oturaraq Sur vә Sidonlulara müraciәt etdi.
Camaat qışqırmağa başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The voice of a god, and not of a man!”

block.text: <<Bu bir insanın sәsi deyil, bir allahın sәsidir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he didn't give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and died.

block.text: O anda Rәbbin bir mәlәyi Hirodu vurdu. Çünki izzәti Allaha vermәdi. Onu daxildәn qurdlar yedi vә canı çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the word of God grew and multiplied.

block.text: Allahın kәlamı isә yayılırdı vә tәsiri artırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem, when they had fulfilled their service, also taking with them John whose surname was Mark.

block.text: Barnaba vә Şaul Yerusәlimdәki öz xidmәtlәrini yerinә yetirәndәn sonra Mark adlanan Yәhyanı özlәri ilә götürüb geri qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 13
Now in the assembly that was at Antioch there were some prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen the foster brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.

block.text: Antakyadakı cәmiyyәtdә peyğәmbәrlәr vә müәllimlәr var idi: Barnaba, Niger adlanan Şimeon, Kirenalı Luki, hökmdar Hirodun süd qardaşı Menaxem vә Şaul.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said,

block.text: Bu adamlar Rәbbә xidmәt edib oruc tutarkәn Müqәddәs Ruh onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.”

block.text: <<Barnaba ilә Şaulu Mәnim tapşırdığım iş üçün ayırın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them, they sent them away.

block.text: Belәliklә, oruc tutub dua etdikdәn sonra Barnaba ilә Şaulun üzәrinә әllәrini qoydu vә onları yola saldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruhun әmri ilә yola çıxan Barnaba vә Şaul Selevkiyaya getdi vә oradan da gәmi ilә Kiprә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they were at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. They had also John as their attendant.

block.text: Salamisә çatanda Yәhudilәrin sinaqoqlarında Allahın kәlamını bәyan etmәyә başladılar. Yәhya isә onların kömәkçisi idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar Jesus.

block.text: Adanı başdan-başa gәzәrәk Pafosa çatdılar. Orada Baryeşu adlı bir Yәhudi cadugәr vә yalançı peyğәmbәrә rast gәldilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, a man of understanding. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul, and sought to hear the word of God.

block.text: Baryeşu vali Sergi Paula yaxın adam idi. Ağıllı kişi olan vali Barnaba ilә Şaulu çağırtdırıb Allahın kәlamına qulaq asmaq istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so is his name by interpretation) withstood them, seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

block.text: Lakin adı cadugәr mәnasını verәn Elima, yәni Baryeşu buna qarşı çıxaraq valini imandan azdırmağa çalışırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Saul, who is also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, fastened his eyes on him,
and said,

block.text: Lakin Müqәddәs Ruhla dolan Şaul, yәni Paul gözlәrini Elimaya
dikib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness!

block.text: <<Ey iblis oğlu, ürәyin hәr cür hiylә vә fırıldaqla doludur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

block.text: Ey salehliyә tamamilә düşmәn kәsilәn, Rәbbin haqq yolunu әyri qәlәmә vermәkdәn әl çәkmәyәcәksәnmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, behold, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a season!”

block.text: İndi isә bax, sәnin üstünә Rәbbin әli gәlir. Kor olacaqsan, bir müddәt gün işığı görmәyәcәksәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately a mist and darkness fell on him. He went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

block.text: O anda hәmin adamın üzәrinә bir duman, bir qaranlıq çökdü. Ora-bura gәzәrәk kimisә axtarırdı ki, onun әlindәn tutub yol göstәrsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the proconsul, when he saw what was done, believed, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.

block.text: Olanları görәn vali Rәbbin tәliminә tәәccüblәndi vә iman etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Paul and his company set sail from Paphos, and came to Perga in Pamphylia. John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.

block.text: Paulla yanındakılar Pafosdan yelkәn açıb Pamfiliya bölgәsindәki Perge şәhәrinә çatdı. Yәhya isә onlardan ayrılıb Yerusәlimә qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they, passing on from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia. They went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and sat down.

block.text: Onlar yollarına davam edib Pergedәn Pisidiyada olan Antakyaya çatdı. Şәnbә günü sinaqoqa girib oturdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying,

block.text: Qanunun vә Peyğәmbәrlәrin yazılarının oxunmasından sonra sinaqoq rәislәri onları çağırtdırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, speak.”

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, xalqa ürәklәndirici müraciәtiniz varsa, buyurub deyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stood up, and beckoning with his hand said,

block.text: Paul ayağa qalxıb diqqәti cәlb etmәk üçün әlini qaldıraraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen.

block.text: <<Ey İsraillilәr vә Allahdan qorxanlar, qulaq asın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

block.text: Bu xalqın, yәni İsraillilәrin sәcdә etdiyi Allah bizim ata-babalarımızı seçdi vә Misirdә – qürbәt eldә yaşadıqları müddәt әrzindә onları böyük bir millәt etdi. Sonra әlini uzadıb onları Misirdәn çıxartdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness.

block.text: Qırx ilә yaxın sәhrada qaldıqları müddәt әrzindә onlara dözdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land for an inheritance, for about four hundred fifty years.

block.text: Kәnan torpağında yaşayan yeddi millәti qırandan sonra bu millәtlәrin torpaqlarını irs olaraq İsrail xalqına verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.

block.text: Bütün bunlar tәqribәn dörd yüz әlli ili әhatә etdi. Sonra Allah onlar üçün hakimlәr yetirdi. Bu, peyğәmbәr Şamuelin dövrünә qәdәr davam etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward they asked for a king, and God gave to them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.

block.text: Xalq padşah istәyәndә isә Allah Binyamin qәbilәsindәn olan Qiş oğlu Şaulu onlar üçün padşah tәyin etdi. O, qırx il padşahlıq etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had removed him, he raised up David to be their king, to whom he also testified, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after my heart, who will do all my will.’

block.text: Onu aradan götürәndәn sonra Allah Davudu ucaldıb onların üzәrindә padşah etdi vә onun barәsindә şәhadәt etdi: “Öz ürәyimә yatan adam olaraq Yessey oğlu Davudu tapdım vә o Mәnim bütün istәdiklәrimi yerinә yetirәcәk”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From this man's seed, God has brought salvation to Israel according to his promise.

block.text: Allah Öz vәdinә sadiq qalıb bu adamın soyundan olan Xilaskar İsanı İsrailә göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Before Jesus came, John had first preached the baptism of repentance to Israel.

block.text: İsanın gәlişindәn әvvәl Yәhya bütün İsrail xalqına vәz etmişdi ki, tövbә edib vәftiz olunsunlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As John was fulfilling his course, he said, ‘What do you suppose that I am? I am not he. But behold, one comes after me the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to untie.’

block.text: Yәhya işini qurtararkәn dedi: “Mәni kim sayırsınız? O Şәxs mәn deyilәm. Mәndәn sonra O gәlir. Mәn Onun ayağındakı çarığını açmağa belә, layiq deyilәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Brothers, children of the stock of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, the word of this salvation is sent out to you.

block.text: Qardaşlar, ey İbrahimin nәslinin övladları vә aranızda olan Allahdan qorxanlar, bu xilas sözü bizә göndәrilib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the inhabitants of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus. By condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets which are read every sabbath day.”

block.text: Çünki Yerusәlim әhalisi vә onların rәhbәrlәri İsanı tanımadı. Belәliklә, Onu mühakimә etmәklә hәr Şәnbә günü oxunan peyğәmbәrlәrin sözünü yerinә yetirdilәr.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Though they found no cause for death, they still asked Pilate to have him killed.

block.text: <<Onda ölümә layiq heç bir tәqsir tapmasalar da, Pilatdan Onun edam olunmasını tәlәb etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had fulfilled all things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree, and laid him in a tomb.

block.text: Onun barәsindә yazılanların hamısını tam yerinә yetirәndәn sonra Onu çarmıxdan düşürüb qәbirә qoydular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But God raised him from the dead.

block.text: Lakin Allah Onu ölülәr arasından diriltdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

block.text: İsa xeyli günlәr әrzindә daha әvvәl Qalileyadan Onunla Yerusәlimә gәlәnlәrә göründü. Bu adamlar indi Onun barәsindә xalq üçün şahiddir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We bring you good news of the promise made to the fathers,

block.text: Biz indi sizә bu Müjdәni bәyan edirik: ata-babalarımıza verilәn vәd hәyata keçib,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that God has fulfilled the same to us, their children, in that he raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second psalm, ‘You are my Son. Today I have become your father.’”

block.text: Allah İsanı diriltmәklә bu vәdi onların övladları olan bizlәr üçün yerinә yetirib. İkinci mәzmurda belә yazılıb: “Sәn Mәnim Oğlumsan, Mәn bu gün Sәnә Ata oldum”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Concerning that he raised him up from the dead, now no more to return to corruption, he has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings of David.’

block.text: Allah Onu ölülәr arasından dirildәrәk heç vaxt çürümәyә qoymayacaq. Ona görә demişdi: “Davuda vәd etdiyim sadiq mәhәbbәti sizә göstәrәcәyәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore he says also in another psalm, ‘You will not allow your Holy One to see decay.’

block.text: Buna görә dә başqa yerdә belә deyir: “Mömin insanını çürümәyә qoymazsan”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay.

block.text: Davud öz müasirlәrinә Allahın iradәsinә müvafiq xidmәt edәndәn sonra vәfat etdi. O da ataları ilә uyudu vә cәsәdi çürüyüb-getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he whom God raised up saw no decay.

block.text: Amma Allahın diriltdiyi İnsanın cismi çürümәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins.

block.text: Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Through him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which they could not be justified by the law of Moses.

block.text: Through him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which they could not be justified by the law of Moses.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware therefore, lest that come on you which is spoken in the prophets:

block.text: Ehtiyatlı olun ki, Peyğәmbәrlәrin dediklәri baş vermәsin:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; for I work a work in your days, a work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.’”

block.text: “Baxın, siz ey xor baxanlar, Mat qalın vә yox olun. Sizin vaxtınızda elә işlәr görәcәyәm ki, Sizә danışsaydılar, inanmazdınız”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged him, saying:

block.text: Buna görə, yəhudilər çıxış sinaqoqu və getdi, bu Gentiles belə ona edirdilər:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Preach these words to us on the next Sabbath.”

block.text: "Növbəti şənbə günü haqqında, bizə bu sözləri vəz."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the synagogue broke up, many of the Jews and of the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas; Paul and Barnabas spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

block.text: Sinaqoqda olan camaat çıxıb gedәndәn sonra xeyli Yәhudi vә Yәhudi dinini qәbul edәn möminlәr Paul vә Barnabanın ardınca getdilәr. Onlar da bu adamlarla söhbәtlәr edir vә Allahın lütfündә dönmәz olsunlar deyә onlara öyüd-nәsihәt verirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next Sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.

block.text: Növbәti Şәnbә Rәbbin kәlamına qulaq asmaq üçün demәk olar ki bütün şәhәr әhalisi toplaşmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

block.text: İzdihamı görәn Yәhudilәri qısqanclıq bürüdü vә Paulun nitqinin әleyhinә qalxıb ona böhtan atdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, and said,

block.text: Paulla Barnaba isә cәsarәtlә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It was necessary that God's word should be spoken to you first. Since indeed you thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.

block.text: <<Allahın kәlamı әvvәlcә sizә bәyan olunmalı idi. Sizin ondan imtina etdiyiniz vә özünüzü әbәdi hәyata layiq görmәdiyiniz üçün biz indi başqa millәtlәrә üz tuturuq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, ‘I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, that you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.’”

block.text: Çünki Rәbbin bizә әmri belә idi: “Sәni millәtlәrә nur etmişәm ki, Xilası dünyanın әn uzaq yerlәrinә yayasan”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed.

block.text: Başqa millәtlәrdәn olanlar bunu eşidәrkәn sevinirdilәr vә Rәbbin kәlamını izzәtlәndirirdilәr. Әbәdi hәyat üçün tәyin olunanların hamısı iman gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord's word was spread abroad throughout all the region.

block.text: Belәliklә, Rәbbin kәlamı bütün bölgәyә yayıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

block.text: Amma Yәhudilәr hörmәtli, mömin qadınları vә şәhәrin nüfuzlu adamlarını tәşvişә saldılar. Onlar da Paulla Barnabanı tәqib edib o bölgәdәn qovdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came to Iconium.

block.text: Buna görә dә Paulla Barnaba ayaqlarının tozunu onların üstünә çırpıb Konyaya getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were filled with joy with the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Şagirdlәr isә sevinc vә Müqәddәs Ruhla doldular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 14
It happened in Iconium that they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude both of Jews and of Greeks believed.

block.text: Konyada Paulla Barnaba Yәhudilәrin sinaqoquna birlikdә daxil olub elә danışdılar ki, hәm Yәhudilәrdәn, hәm dә Yunanlardan ibarәt böyük kütlәni imana gәtirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the disbelieving Jews stirred up and embittered the souls of the Gentiles against the brothers.

block.text: Amma inanmayan Yәhudilәr başqa millәtlәrdәn olanları qızışdıraraq onları imanlıların әleyhinә qaldırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord. The Lord testified to the word of his grace by granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

block.text: Xeyli vaxt orada qalan Paulla Barnaba cәsarәtlә Rәbb haqqında danışırdı. Rәbb isә onlara әlamәt vә xariqә göstәrmәk gücünü vermәklә Öz lütfü barәdә kәlamı tәsdiqlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitude of the city was divided. Part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.

block.text: Amma şәhәr әhalisi iki hissәyә bölündü. Bәzilәri Yәhudilәrin, bәzilәri isә hәvarilәrin tәrәfini saxladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of both the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, made a violent attempt to mistreat and stone them.

block.text: Yәhudilәrlә başqa millәtlәrdәn olanlar vә onların rәhbәrlәri hәvarilәri tәhqir edәrәk daşqalaq etmәk üçün bir sui-qәsd hazırladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they became aware of it, they fled to the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra, Derbe, and the surrounding region.

block.text: Bundan xәbәr tutan bu hәvarilәr Likaoniyanın Listra ilә Derbe şәhәrlәrinә vә oranın әtraf yerlәrinә qaçdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There they preached the Good News.

block.text: Orada da Müjdәni yaydılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At Lystra a certain man sat, crippled in his feet from birth, who had never walked.

block.text: Listrada ayaqlarından şikәst olan bir kişi var idi. Bu adam anadangәlmә әlil idi, heç vaxt yerimәmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was listening to Paul speaking. Paul fastened his eyes on him, and saw that he had faith to be made whole.

block.text: O, Paulun dediklәrinә qulaq asırdı. Ona göz qoyan Paul gördü ki, sağalacağına imanı var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said with a loud voice,

block.text: Ona görә bәrkdәn dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand upright on your feet!”

block.text: <<Qalx, ayaq üstә dur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He leaped up and walked.

block.text: Bu adam yerindәn atılıb yerimәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the multitude saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the language of Lycaonia,

block.text: Camaat Paulun etdiyini görәndә haray salıb Likaoniya dilindә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”

block.text: <<Tanrılar insan şәklindә yanımıza gәlib!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called Barnabas “Jupiter,” and Paul “Mercury,” because he was the chief speaker.

block.text: Barnabaya Zevs, Paula isә aparıcı natiq olduğuna görә Hermes dedilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The priest of Jupiter, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, and would have made a sacrifice along with the multitudes.

block.text: Şәhәrin qarşısında yerlәşәn Zevs mәbәdinin kahini şәhәr darvazalarına buğalar vә çәlәnglәr gәtirdi. O, camaatla birgә qurban kәsmәk istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the apostles, Barnabas and Paul, heard of it, they tore their clothes, and sprang into the multitude, crying out,

block.text: Amma hәvarilәr – Barnaba ilә Paul bunu eşidәn kimi paltarlarını cırdı vә izdihamın içinә girib haray çәkdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men of like passions with you. We bring you good news, that you should turn from these vain things to the living God, who made the sky and the earth and the sea, and all that is in them.

block.text: <<Ay ağalar, niyә belә edirsiniz? Biz dә sizin kimi insanıq, eyni varlığıq. Sizә Müjdә gәtirmişik. Әl çәkin bu boş şeylәrdәn. Yeri, göyü, dәnizi vә bunların içindәki hәr şeyi yaradan, var olan Allaha tәrәf dönün.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the generations gone by, He allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways.

block.text: O, әvvәlki nәsillәrin dövründә yaşayan bütün millәtlәrә öz yolları ilә getmәyә izin verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet he didn't leave himself without witness, in that he did good and gave you rains from the sky and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”

block.text: Lakin yenә dә Özünü şahidsiz qoymadı. Sizә yaxşılıq edәrәk göydәn yağışlar yağdırır, cürbәcür mәhsullar yetişdirәn fәsillәr bәxş edir, sizi yemәklә doydurur vә ürәyinizi sevincә qәrq edir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even saying these things, they hardly stopped the multitudes from making a sacrifice to them.

block.text: Bu sözlәrlә camaatın onlara qurban kәsmәsinin qarşısını bir çәtinliklә aldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and they persuaded the crowd to take their side. Then they stoned Paul and dragged him out of town, because they thought that he was dead.

block.text: Antakya vә Konyadan bәzi Yәhudilәr gәlib xalqı öz tәrәfinә çәkәrәk Paulu daşqalaq etdilәr. Elә bildilәr ki, Paul ölüb, onu şәhәrdәn kәnara sürüdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But as the disciples stood around him, he rose up, and entered into the city. On the next day he went out with Barnabas to Derbe.

block.text: Şagirdlәr әtrafına yığılanda isә Paul ayağa qalxıb şәhәrә qayıtdı. Ertәsi gün isә Barnaba ilә birlikdә Derbeyә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had preached the Good News to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch.

block.text: O şәhәrdә dә Müjdә yayıb xeyli şagird hazırladılar. Paulla Barnaba daha sonra Listraya, Konyaya vә Pisidiyada olan Antakyaya qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They strengthened the disciples and encouraged them to continue in the faith, and said:

block.text: Şagirdlәri ruhәn möhkәmlәndirdilәr vә imanda dönmәz olsunlar deyә onları hәvәslәndirәrәk dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Through many afflictions we will enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığına çox әziyyәtlәrdәn keçәrәk girmәliyik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had appointed elders for them in every assembly, and had prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord, on whom they had believed.

block.text: İmanlılar üçün hәr cәmiyyәtdә ağsaqqallar seçәrәk dua vә orucla onları inandıqları Rәbbә әmanәt etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.

block.text: Pisidiya bölgәsindәn keçәrәk Pamfiliyaya gәldilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

block.text: Pergedә kәlamı yayandan sonra Antalyaya getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there they sailed to Antioch, from where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work which they had fulfilled.

block.text: Oradan gәmi ilә Suriyadakı Antakyaya qayıtdılar. Onların indi yerinә yetirdiklәri xidmәt üçün burada Allahın lütfünә әmanәt edilmişdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had arrived, and had gathered the assembly together, they reported all the things that God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith to the nations.

block.text: Oraya çatanda cәmiyyәti bir yerә yığıb Allahın onlar vasitәsilә nә etdiyini, başqa millәtlәrә iman qapısını necә açdığını söylәdilәr

ReferenceBlocks.text: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.

block.text: vә şagirdlәrin yanında uzun müddәt qaldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 15
Some men came down from Judea and taught the brothers,

block.text: Yәhudeyadan gәlәn bәzi adamlar Antakyadakı imanlı bacı-qardaşlara belә tәlim öyrәdirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless you are circumcised after the custom of Moses, you can't be saved.”

block.text: <<Әgәr siz Musanın qoyduğu adәtә görә sünnәt olmasanız, xilas ola bilmәzsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Paul and Barnabas had no small discord and discussion with them. They appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others of them to go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.

block.text: Paul vә Barnaba bu adamlarla çox çәkişib mübahisә etdi. Nәhayәt qәrara alındı ki, Paulla Barnaba digәr qardaşlardan bir neçәsini götürәrәk Yerusәlimә gedib bu sual әtrafında hәvarilәr vә ağsaqqallarla görüşsünlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, being sent on their way by the assembly, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles. They caused great joy to all the brothers.

block.text: They, being sent on their way by the assembly, passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles. They caused great joy to all the brothers.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the assembly and the apostles and the elders, and they reported all things that God had done with them.

block.text: Yerusәlimә çatanda oradakı imanlılar cәmiyyәti vә hәvarilәrlә ağsaqqallar onları yaxşı qarşıladılar. Allahın onlar vasitәsilә etdiyi hәr şeyi danışdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying,

block.text: Amma farisey tәriqәtindәn olmuş bәzi imanlılar qalxıb belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.”

block.text: <<Başqa millәtlәrdәn olanları sünnәt etmәk vә onlara Musanın Qanununa riayәt etmәlәrini әmr etmәk lazımdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles and the elders were gathered together to see about this matter.

block.text: Hәvarilәrlә ağsaqqallar bu mövzunun müzakirәsi üçün toplaşdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When there had been much discussion, Peter rose up and said to them,

block.text: Uzun-uzadı mübahisәlәrdәn sonra Peter ayağa qalxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, you know that a good while ago God made a choice among you, that by my mouth the nations should hear the word of the Good News, and believe.

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, bildiyiniz kimi Allah aranızdan çoxdan bәri mәni seçib ki, başqa millәtlәrdәn olanlar Müjdәni mәnim dilimdәn eşidib iman etsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God, who knows the heart, testified about them, giving them the Holy Spirit, just like he did to us.

block.text: İnsanın ürәyindәn xәbәrdar olan Allah bizә verdiyi kimi Müqәddәs Ruhu onlara da vermәklә tәsdiq etdi ki, onları qәbul edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.

block.text: Onlarla bizim aramızda heç bir ayrı-seçkilik yaratmadı, imanları ilә onların da ürәklәrini tәmizlәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now therefore why do you tempt God, that you should put a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?

block.text: Elә isә nә bizim, nә dә ata-babalarımızın gәzdirә bilmәdiyi boyunduruğu niyә bu şagirdlәrin boynuna yüklәyәrәk Allahı sınağa çәkirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, just as they are.”

block.text: Әksinә, inanırıq ki, biz dә Rәbb İsanın lütfü ilә xilas oluruq, onlar da>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All those assembled kept silence, and they listened to Barnabas and Paul reporting what signs and wonders God had done among the nations through them.

block.text: Onda bütün toplantı sakitlәşdi vә Barnaba ilә Paula qulaq asmağa başladılar. Barnaba ilә Paul Allahın onlar vasitәsilә başqa millәtlәr arasında göstәrdiyi әlamәt vә xariqәlәrin hamısını danışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they were silent, James answered,

block.text: Onlar sözlәrini yekunlaşdırandan sonra Yaqub söz alıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, listen to me.
Simeon has reported how God first visited the nations, to take out of them a people for his name.

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, mәnә qulaq asın!
Allah başqa millәtlәrdәn Öz adı üçün bir xalq yaratmaq mәqsәdi ilә onlara ilk dәfә necә nәzәr salması barәdә Şimon izahat verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This agrees with the words of the prophets. As it is written,

block.text: Peyğәmbәrlәrin sözlәri bunu tәsdiqlәyir. Orada yazıldığı kimi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘After these things I will return. I will again build the tabernacle of David, which has fallen. I will again build its ruins. I will set it up again.

block.text: “Bundan sonra qayıdacağam, Davudun yıxılan çadırını bәrpa edәcәyәm. Onun dağılan yerlәrini yenidәn tikәcәyәm, Onu әvvәlki halına salacağam,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the rest of men may seek after the Lord; All the Gentiles who are called by my name, Says the Lord, who does all these things.

block.text: Then the rest of men may seek after the Lord; All the Gentiles who are called by my name, Says the Lord, who does all these things.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All his works are known to God from eternity.’”

block.text: All his works are known to God from eternity.'>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore my judgment is that we don't trouble those from among the Gentiles who turn to God.

block.text: <<Belәliklә, bu qәrara gәlmişәm ki, başqa millәtlәrdәn Allaha tәrәf dönәnlәrә maneçilik törәtmәmәliyik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Instead, we write to them that they abstain from the pollution of idols, from sexual immorality, from what is strangled, and from blood.

block.text: Lakin onlara yazmalıyıq ki, bütlәrә tәqdim olunub murdarlanan qurbanların әtini, boğularaq öldürülәn heyvanların әtini vә qan yemәsinlәr; әxlaqsızlıqdan da özlәrini uzaq saxlasınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses from generations of old has in every city those who preach him, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”

block.text: Çünki qәdim nәsillәrin dövründәn bәri hәr şәhәrdә Musanın sözlәrini vәz edәnlәr var vә bu sözlәr hәr Şәnbә günü sinaqoqlarda oxunmaqdadır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: They chose Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers.

block.text: Then it seemed good to the apostles and the elders, with the whole assembly, to choose men out of their company, and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas: They chose Judas called Barsabbas, and Silas, chief men among the brothers.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They wrote these things by their hand:

block.text: They wrote these things by their hand:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The apostles, the elders, and the brothers, to the brothers who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: greetings.

block.text: <<İmanlı qardaşlarınız olan biz hәvarilәrlә ağsaqqallardan Antakya, Suriya vә Kilikiyada yaşayan, başqa millәtlәrdәn olan bacı-qardaşlara salam!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, ‘You must be circumcised and keep the law,’ to whom we gave no commandment;

block.text: Eşitdik ki, bizlәrdәn bәzi adamlar yanınıza gәlib sözlәri ilә sizi lәrzәyә salaraq düşüncәlәrinizi qarışdırıblar. Lakin bunu onlara biz tapşırmamışdıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: it seemed good to us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul.

block.text: Ona görә dә aramızdan bәzi adamları seçib sevimli dostlarımız Barnaba vә Paulla bәrabәr sizin yanınıza göndәrmәyi yekdilliklә qәrara aldıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These men have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: Hәr ikisi Rәbbimiz İsa Mәsihin adı uğrunda canını tәhlükәyә atıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves will also tell you the same things by word of mouth.

block.text: Qәrarımıza müvafiq sizin yanınıza Yәhuda ilә Silanı göndәririk ki, eyni şeylәri sizә şifahi olaraq şәrh etsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay no greater burden on you than these necessary things:

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruh vә biz vacib olan bu qaydalardan başqa sizin üstünüzә heç nәyi yüklәmәmәyi lazım bildik:

ReferenceBlocks.text: that you abstain from things sacrificed to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality, from which if you keep yourselves, it will be well with you. Farewell.”

block.text: Bütlәrә tәqdim olunan qurbanların әtini, boğularaq öldürülәn heyvanların әtini vә qan yemәyin; әxlaqsızlıqdan da özünüzü uzaq saxlayın. Bunlardan qaçsanız, düz edәrsiniz. Salamat qalın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So, when they were sent off, they came to Antioch. Having gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.

block.text: Belәliklә, adamlar yola düşüb Antakyaya getdi vә camaatı bir yerә yığıb mәktubu onlara verdi.
