ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

block.text: İmanlılar ucadan oxunan mәktubun ürәklәndirici sözlәrindәn sevindilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many words, and strengthened them.

block.text: İkisi dә peyğәmbәr olan Yәhuda vә Sila bir çox danışıqlar apararaq imanlı bacı-qardaşları ürәklәndirib ruhәn möhkәmlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After they had spent some time there, they were sent back with greetings from the brothers to the apostles.

block.text: Bir müddәt orada qalandan sonra onları göndәrәnlәrin yanına qayıtmaq üzrә bacı-qardaşlar tәrәfindәn әmin-arxayın yola salındılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Silas was pleased to stay there.
But Paul and Barnabas stayed in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.

block.text: Paulla Barnaba Antakyada qalıb xeyli başqa adamla birlikdә Rәbbin kәlamını öyrәdәrәk Müjdәni yaydılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After some days Paul said to Barnabas,

block.text: Bundan bir qәdәr sonra Paul Barnabaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's return now and visit our brothers in every city in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”

block.text: <<Rәbbin kәlamını elan etdiyimiz bütün şәhәrlәrә qayıdıb imanlı bacı-qardaşlara baş çәkәk, hal-әhval tutaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Barnabas said:

block.text: Barnaba dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's take John who is also called Mark with us.”

block.text: "Bizi John de Mark bizimlə deyilir alalım."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said:

block.text: Lakin Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not a good idea to take someone who deserted us in Pamphylia, and did not continue with us in the work.”

block.text: "Bu, yaxşı bir fikir Bizimlə Pamphylia ildə kimsə geri almaq üçün deyil, bizimlə iş davam etmədi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the contention grew so sharp that they separated from each other. Barnabas took Mark with him, and sailed away to Cyprus.

block.text: Onların arasında elә kәskin fikir ayrılığı oldu ki, bir-birlәrindәn ayrıldılar. Barnaba Markı götürüb Kiprә doğru yelkәn açdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul chose Silas, and went out, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

block.text: Paul isә Silanı seçdi vә imanlı bacı-qardaşlar tәrәfindәn Rәbbin lütfünә әmanәt edilәndәn sonra yola çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the assemblies.

block.text: Onlar Suriya vә Kilikiyanı gәzib-dolaşdı vә cәmiyyәtlәri möhkәmlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 16
He came to Derbe and Lystra: and behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy. He was the son of a Jewess who believed; but his father was a Greek.

block.text: Paul Derbe vә Listraya gәldi. Listrada Timotey adlı bir İsa şagirdi var idi. Onun anası imanlı bir Yәhudi, atası isә Yunan idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The brothers who were at Lystra and Iconium gave a good testimony about him.

block.text: Listra vә Konyadakı imanlı bacı-qardaşlar onun barәsindә xoş sözlәr deyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul wanted to have him go out with him, and he took and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those parts; for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

block.text: Timoteyi özü ilә aparmaq istәyәn Paul bu şәhәrlәrdәki Yәhudilәrә görә onu sünnәt etdi. Çünki hamı onun atasının Yunan olduğunu bilirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went on their way through the cities, they delivered the decrees to them to keep which had been ordained by the apostles and elders who were at Jerusalem.

block.text: Onlar şәhәrbәşәhәr gәzib-dolaşır, Yerusәlimdәki hәvarilәrlә ağsaqqalların qәrara aldığı qaydaları imanlılara deyir vә göstәrirdi ki, bunlara riayәt etsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the assemblies were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.

block.text: Belәliklә, cәmiyyәtlәr imanda güclәnir vә sayı günbәgün artırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

block.text: Müqәddәs Ruh onlara imkan vermәdi ki, Asiya vilayәtindә kәlamı yaysınlar. Ona görә dә onlar Frigiya vә Qalatiya әrazisini keçib getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come opposite Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit didn't allow them.

block.text: Misiya sәrhәdinә gәlәrkәn Bitinyaya getmәyә çalışdılar. Amma İsanın Ruhu onlara izin vermәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.

block.text: Ona görә Misiyadan keçib Troasa getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A vision appeared to Paul in the night. There was a man of Macedonia standing, begging him, and saying,

block.text: O gecә Paul bir görüntü gördü. Makedoniyalı bir nәfәr onun qarşısında durub yalvarırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come over into Macedonia and help us.”

block.text: <<Makedoniyaya gәl vә bizә kömәk et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go out to Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the Good News to them.

block.text: Paul bu görüntünü görәndәn sonra Makedoniyaya getmәk üçün dәrhal bir yol axtardıq. Bundan nәticә çıxartdıq ki, Allah bizi orada Müjdә yaymaq üçün çağırır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis.

block.text: Troasdan yelkәn açıb birbaşa Samotraki adasına vә ertәsi gün isә Neapolisә gәldik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there we went to Philippi, which is a city of Macedonia, the foremost of the district, a Roman colony. We were staying some days in this city.

block.text: Oradan Filipiyә keçdik. Bura Makedoniya bölgәsindә әhәmiyyәtli bir şәhәrdir, әhalisi әsasәn Romalılardır. Bu şәhәrdә bir neçә gün qaldıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the Sabbath day we went forth outside of the city by a riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer. We sat down, and spoke to the women who had come together.

block.text: Şәnbә günü şәhәr darvazasından çıxıb çay kәnarına getdik. Elә bildik ki, Yәhudilәr adәtәn oraya dua etmәk üçün yığılır. Oturduq, oraya yığılan qadınlarla söhbәt etmәyә başladıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one who worshiped God, heard us. The Lord opened her heart to listen to the things which were spoken by Paul.

block.text: Bizә qulaq asanlar arasında Tiatira şәhәrindәn tünd qırmızı parça satan, Allaha mömin olan Lidiya adlı bir qadın var idi. Paulun sözlәrinә qulaq asmaq üçün Rәbb ona açıq ürәk vermişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she and her household were baptized, she begged us, saying,

block.text: Lidiya ev әhli ilә bәrabәr vәftiz olunduqdan sonra bizi evinә dәvәt edib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come into my house, and stay.”

block.text: <<Әgәr siz mәni Rәbbә sadiq bir insan kimi qәbul edirsinizsә, gәlin, mәnim evimdә qalın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So she persuaded us.

block.text: O bizi buna razı etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as we were going to prayer, that a certain girl having a spirit of divination met us. She brought her masters much gain by fortune telling.

block.text: Bir gün biz dua yerinә gedәrkәn falçılıq ruhuna tutulan bir qarabaş qarşımıza çıxdı. Bu qız baxıcılıq edәrәk öz ağalarına nә qәdәr qazanc gәtirmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Following Paul and us, she cried out,

block.text: O, Paulun vә bizim ardımızca düşәrәk qışqıra-qışqıra deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us a way of salvation!”

block.text: <<Bu adamlar Allah-Taalanın qullarıdır. Sizә xilas yolunu bildirirlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She was doing this for many days. But Paul, becoming greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit,

block.text: Bunu günbәgün tәkrar etdi. Bu, Paulu çox bezdirdi. Nәhayәt, o çevrilib ruha dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!”

block.text: <<İsa Mәsihin adı ilә sәnә әmr edirәm, bu qızdan çıx!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came out that very hour.

block.text: Ruh dәrhal qızdan çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when her masters saw that the hope of their gain was gone, they seized Paul and Silas, and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers.

block.text: Qızın ağaları görәndә ki bu qazancdan ümidlәri kәsildi, Paulla Silanı tutub bazar meydanına – rәhbәrlәrin qarşısına gәtirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had brought them to the magistrates, they said,

block.text: Onları hakimlәrin qarşısına çıxararaq dedilәr:

block.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl
ReferenceBlocks.text: “These men, being Jews, are agitating our city.

block.text: <<Bu adamlar Yәhudidir. Şәhәrimizә qarışıqlıq salıblar.

block.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: owners of fortune telling slave girl
ReferenceBlocks.text: They set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to accept or to observe, being Romans.”

block.text: Biz Romalılara qәbulu vә icrası qadağan olunan adәtlәri yayırlar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude rose up together against them, and the magistrates tore their clothes off of them, and commanded them to be beaten with rods.

block.text: Xalq da Paulla Silanın әleyhinә çıxdı. Hakimlәr әmr verdi ki, onların әyinlәrindәki paltarları soyundurub dәyәnәklә döysünlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, charging the jailer to keep them safely.

block.text: Onlara çox zәrbә vurdular vә sonra zindana atdılar. Zindanın baş mühafizәçisinә әmr verdilәr ki, onları möhkәm nәzarәt altında saxlasınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Upon receiving such an order, he threw them into the inner prison, and secured their feet in the stocks.

block.text: Bu әmri alan baş mühafizәçi onları zindanın xüsusi otağına aparıb ayaqlarını kündәyә saldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But about midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.

block.text: Gecә yarısına yaxın Paulla Sila dua edir vә Allaha ilahilәr oxuyurdu. Digәr mәhbuslar da onlara qulaq asırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. Immediately all the doors were opened, and everyone's bonds were loosened.

block.text: Birdәn elә güclü zәlzәlә oldu ki, zindanın tәmәli belә, yerindәn oynadı. Bir andaca bütün qapılar açıldı, hamının zәncirlәri töküldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The jailer, being roused out of sleep and seeing the prison doors open, drew his sword and was about to kill himself. He thought that the prisoners had escaped.

block.text: Baş mühafizәçi oyanıb zindanın qapılarını açıq görәndә qılıncını çәkib canına qәsd etmәk istәdi. Elә bildi ki, mәhbuslar qaçıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul cried out,

block.text: Amma Paul bәrkdәn qışqırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't harm yourself, for we are all here!”

block.text: <<Canına qıyma, hamımız buradayıq!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called for lights and sprang in, and, fell down trembling before Paul and Silas.

block.text: Baş mühafizәçi işıq gәtirdib içәri qaçdı. Titrәyә-titrәyә Paul vә Silanın qarşısında yerә düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He brought them out and said,

block.text: Onları bayıra çıxararaq soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

block.text: <<Ağalar, xilas olmaq üçün nә etmәliyәm?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.”

block.text: <<Rәbb İsaya iman et, sәn dә, ev әhlin dә xilas olarsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They spoke the word of the Lord to him, and to all who were in his house.

block.text: Sonra hәm ona, hәm dә onun ev әhlinә Rәbbin kәlamını bildirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them the same hour of the night, and washed their stripes. He was immediately baptized, he and all his household.

block.text: Gecәnin bu vәdәsindә baş mühafizәçi onları götürüb yaralarını yudu. Sonra hәm özü, hәm dә ev әhli dәrhal vәftiz oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He brought them up into his house, and set food before them. He rejoiced greatly with all his household, having believed in God.

block.text: Paulla Silanı evinә aparıb onlar üçün süfrә açdı. Allaha iman etdiklәrinә görә o vә bütün ev әhli şad oldular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when it was day, the magistrates sent the sergeants, saying,

block.text: Sәhәr açılanda hakimlәr yasavullar göndәrib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let those men go.”

block.text: <<Bu adamları azad et>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The jailer reported these words to Paul, saying,

block.text: Baş mühafizәçi bu sözlәri Paula çatdırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The magistrates have sent to let you go; now therefore come out, and go in peace.”

block.text: <<Hakimlәr xәbәr göndәrdi ki, siz azad edilәsiniz. İndi çıxın, arxayın gedin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said to them,

block.text: Amma Paul yasavullara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have beaten us publicly, without a trial, men who are Romans, and have cast us into prison! Do they now release us secretly? No, most certainly, but let them come themselves and bring us out!”

block.text: <<Roma vәtәndaşı ola-ola bizi mәhkәmәsiz hamının qarşısında döyüb zindana atdılar. İndi bizi gizli-gizli qovmaq istәyirlәrmi? Belә şey ola bilmәz! Özlәri gәlsin, bizi buradan çıxarsın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sergeants reported these words to the magistrates. They were afraid when they heard that they were Romans.

block.text: Yasavullar bu sözlәri hakimlәrә çatdırdılar. Hakimlәr Paulla Silanın Roma vәtәndaşı olduğunu eşidәndә qorxdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to appease them, escorted them from the prison, and requested them, saying:

block.text: Onlar, onları sakitləşdirmək üçün gəldi, zindan onları eşlik ediyordu, onlara tələb edib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Please, leave our city.”

block.text: "Xahiş edirik, bizim şəhərin buraxın."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out of the prison, and entered into Lydia's house. When they had seen the brothers, they encouraged them, and departed.

block.text: Paulla Sila zindandan çıxandan sonra Lidiyanın evinә getdilәr. İmanlı bacı-qardaşlarla görüşüb onları ruhlandırandan sonra yola düşüb getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 17
Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

block.text: Onlar Amfipolis vә Apolloniyadan keçәrәk Salonikә gәldi. Burada bir Yәhudi sinaqoqu var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul, as was his custom, went to them, and for three Sabbath days reasoned with them from the Scriptures.

block.text: Paul adәtinә görә Yәhudilәrin yanına gedib üç Şәnbә dalbadal onlarla Müqәddәs Yazılar üstündә mübahisә etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He explained and demonstrated that the Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and said,

block.text: O, izah və Məsih əzab və ölülərdən yenidən qalxmağa olduğunu nümayiş dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This Jesus, whom I proclaim to you, is the Christ.”

block.text: <<Sizә elan etmәkdә olduğum bu İsa Mәsihdir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of them were persuaded, and joined Paul and Silas, of the devout Greeks a great multitude, and not a few of the chief women.

block.text: Yәhudilәrdәn bәzilәri, mömin Yunanların böyük bir hissәsi, bir çox nüfuzlu qadınlar buna әmin oldu vә Paulla Silaya qoşuldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the unpersuaded Jews took along some wicked men from the marketplace, and gathering a crowd, set the city in an uproar. Assaulting the house of Jason, they sought to bring them out to the people.

block.text: Yәhudilәrin buna paxıllığı tutdu. Meydana yığılan camaatın içәrisindә olan bәzi şәr adamlardan bir izdiham toplayıb şәhәrdә qarışıqlıq saldılar. Paulla Silanı xalqın önünә çıxarmaq mәqsәdi ilә Yasonun evinә hücum etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they didn't find them, they dragged Jason and certain brothers before the rulers of the city, crying,

block.text: Onları tapmayanda Yasonla bәzi imanlı qardaşları sürüyә-sürüyә şәhәr başçılarının qarşısına gәtirib hay-küy saldılar:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “These who have turned the world upside down have come here also.

block.text: <<Dünyaya çaxnaşma salan bu adamlar gәlib buraya da çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These people whom Jason has received all act contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying that there is another king, Jesus!”

block.text: Yason onları öz evinә qәbul edib. Bunların hamısı qeysәrin fәrmanlarının әksinә gedib deyir ki, İsa adlı başqa bir padşah var>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude and the rulers of the city were troubled when they heard these things.

block.text: Bu sözlәri eşidәn izdiham vә şәhәr başçıları lәrzәyә düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.

block.text: Nәhayәt, başçılar tәminat alaraq Yason vә digәrlәrini azad etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea. When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

block.text: İmanlı bacı-qardaşlar isә gecә olan kimi Paulla Silanı dәrhal Veriya şәhәrinә göndәrdi. Onlar oraya çatarkәn Yәhudilәrin sinaqoquna getdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica. This is because they received the word with all readiness of the mind, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so.

block.text: Veriyadakı Yәhudilәrsә Salonikdә olanlardan daha açıq fikirli idi. Kәlamı böyük hәvәslә qarşılayaraq hәr gün Müqәddәs Yazıları araşdırır, <<Bu düzgün tәlimdirmi?>> deyә yoxlayırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of them therefore believed; also of the prominent Greek women, and not a few men.

block.text: Belәliklә, onların arasından xeyli adam, hәmçinin çoxlu hörmәtli Yunan qadınları vә kişilәri iman etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Beroea also, they came there likewise, agitating the multitudes.

block.text: Lakin Salonikdәki Yәhudilәr Paulun Veriyada da Allahın kәlamını elan etdiyini bilәndә oraya getdilәr vә xalqı qızışdırıb lәrzәyә saldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the brothers immediately sent out Paul to go as far as to the sea, and Silas and Timothy still stayed there.

block.text: Bundan sonra imanlı bacı-qardaşlar Paulu dәrhal dәniz sahilinә gedәn yolla göndәrdilәr. Sila ilә Timotey isә Veriyada qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens. Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him very quickly, they departed.

block.text: Paulu yola salanlar onu Afinaya qәdәr ötürdülәr. Sonra Paul onlara әmr verdi ki, geri qayıdıb Sila ilә Timoteyi tәcili surәtdә onun yanına göndәrsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him as he saw the city full of idols.

block.text: Onları Afinada gözlәyәn Paul gördü ki, şәhәr bütlәrlә doludur. Bundan ötrü onun ürәyi çox narahat oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with those who met him.

block.text: Buna görә sinaqoqda Yәhudilәrlә vә mömin Yunanlarla, hәr gün bazar meydanında rastlaşdığı insanlarla mübahisә edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also were conversing with him. Some said,

block.text: Epikürçü vә Stoist fәlsәfi cәrәyanından olanların bәzilәri onunla mübahisәyә girişdi. Kimisi deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this babbler want to say?”

block.text: <<Bu boşboğaz nә demәk istәyir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Kimisi dә deyir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He seems to be advocating foreign deities,”

block.text: <<Deyәsәn bu yad allahların tәbliğatçısıdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.

block.text: Çünki Paul İsa vә dirilmә ilә bağlı Müjdәni yaymaqda idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took hold of him, and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus, saying:

block.text: Onlar Paulu götürüb Areopaq mәşvәrәtinә gәtirdilәr. Ondan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?

block.text: <<Sәnin yaydığın bu yeni tәlimin nә olduğunu bilmәk olarmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you bring certain strange things to our ears. We want to know therefore what these things mean.”

block.text: Çünki qulağımız öyrәşmәdiyi şeylәri bizә eşitdirirsәn. İndi bunların mәnasını bilmәk istәyirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.

block.text: Bütün Afinalılar vә şәhәrdәki yadellilәr vaxtlarını yalnız yeni fikirlәri söylәyәrәk vә qulaq asaraq keçirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul stood in the middle of the Areopagus and said,

block.text: Paul Areopaqın qarşısına çıxıb belә söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Athens, I perceive that you are very religious in all things.

block.text: <<Ey Afinalılar, sizin hәr cәhәtdәn çox pәrәstişkar olduğunuzu görürәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: ‘TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.’ What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you.

block.text: Belә ki mәn әtrafda gәzәndә sәcdәgahlarınıza diqqәtlә nәzәr salarkәn bir qurbangaha da rast gәldim ki, onun üstündә yazılmışdı: “Namәlum Allaha mәxsus”. Tanımadan ibadәt etdiyiniz bu Allahı sizә tanıtmaq istәyirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The God who made the world and all things in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, doesn't dwell in temples made with hands.

block.text: Dünyanı vә onda mövcud olan hәr şeyi yaradan, yerin-göyün Sahibi olan Allah әllә tikilәn mәbәdlәrdә yaşamaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither is he served by men's hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all life and breath, and all things.

block.text: İnsan әli ilә edilәn xidmәtә Onun ehtiyacı yoxdur, çünki hәr kәsә hәyat, nәfәs vә hәr şeyi verәn Odur!

ReferenceBlocks.text: He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth, having determined appointed seasons, and the boundaries of their dwellings.

block.text: Allah bütün bәşәriyyәtin millәtlәrini bir insandan yaratdı ki, bütün yer üzәrindә yaşasınlar. Yaşamaq üçün onlara zaman vә mәkan tәyin etdi ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: God did this so that men would seek the Lord, if perhaps they might reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us.

block.text: Onu axtarsınlar, yәni kor әllәrini sürtә-sürtә yol axtardığı kimi axtarıb Onu tapa bilsinlәr. Әslindә Allah heç birimizdәn uzaq deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘For in him we live, and move, and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also his offspring.’

block.text: “Axı biz Onda yaşayırıq, hәrәkәt edirik, mövcuduq”. Bәzi şairlәrinizin dediyi kimi: “Biz dә Onun nәslindәnik”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like gold, or silver, or stone, engraved by art and design of man.

block.text: Demәk biz Allahın nәslindәn olduğumuza görә belә düşünmәk olmaz ki, İlahi Varlıq insan layihәsi vә istedadı ilә yaranan qızıl, gümüş vә yaxud daşdan düzәldilәn bir şeyә bәnzәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked. But now he commands that all people everywhere should repent.

block.text: Allah cәhalәt zamanlarında buna göz yumdu, amma indi hәr yerdә hamının tövbә etmәsini insanlara әmr edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has ordained; of which he has given assurance to all men, in that he has raised him from the dead.”

block.text: Çünki Allah Öz seçdiyi Şәxs vasitәsilә dünyanı әdalәtlә mühakimә edәcәyi günü tәyin edib. Onu ölülәr arasından diriltmәklә hamının qarşısında bunu tәsdiq edib>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said,

block.text: Ölülәrin dirilmәsi ilә bağlı sözlәri eşidәn kimi bәzilәri onu әlә saldı, kimisi dә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We want to hear you again concerning this.”

block.text: <<Bu barәdә sәndәn bir daha eşitmәk istәyirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus Paul went out from among them.

block.text: Belәliklә, Paul onların arasından çıxıb getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But certain men joined with him, and believed, among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them.

block.text: Bir neçә insan isә ona qoşulub iman gәtirdi. Bunların arasında Areopaq üzvü Dionis, Damaris adlı bir qadın vә başqaları da var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 18
After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth.

block.text: Bundan sonra Paul Afinadan çıxıb Korinfә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He found a certain Jew named Aquila, a man of Pontus by race. He had recently come from Italy, with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome. Paul went to see Aquila and Priscilla.

block.text: Orada Pontda doğulan Akila adlı bir Yәhudiyә rast gәldi. O, arvadı Priskila ilә birlikdә İtaliyadan yenicә gәlmişdi. Çünki Klavdi әmr vermişdi ki, Romada olan bütün Yәhudilәr oradan çıxsınlar. Paul onların yanına getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Because he practiced the same trade, he lived with them and worked, for by trade they were tent makers.

block.text: Onların peşәsi çadırçılıq idi vә eyni peşә sahibi olan Paul buna görә onların yanında qalıb çalışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded Jews and Greeks.

block.text: Paul hәr Şәnbә günü sinaqoqda mübahisә edib hәm Yәhudilәri, hәm dә Yunanları inandırırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul was compelled by the Spirit, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ.

block.text: Sila ilә Timotey Makedoniyadan gәlәn kimi Paul özünü tamamilә kәlama hәsr etdi vә Yәhudilәrә İsanın Mәsih olmasına dair şәhadәt edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they opposed him and blasphemed, he shook out his clothing and said to them,

block.text: Amma Yәhudilәr onun әleyhinә çıxaraq böhtan atmağa başlayan kimi Paul yaxasını çırpıb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your blood be on your own heads! I am clean. From now on, I will go to the Gentiles!”

block.text: <<Qanınız öz başınıza dönsün, bu işdә tәmizәm. Bundan sonra mәn başqa millәtlәrdәn olanların yanına gedәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He departed there, and went into the house of a certain man named Justus, one who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.

block.text: Paul oradan çıxdı, Allaha mömin olan Titi Yust adlı bir nәfәrin evinә getdi. Onun evi sinaqoqa bitişik idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord with all his house. Many of the Corinthians, when they heard, believed and were baptized.

block.text: Sinaqoq rәisi Krisp bütün ev әhli ilә birgә Rәbbә iman etdi. Korinflilәrin bir çoxu Paulu dinlәyәndә iman gәtirәrәk vәftiz oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to Paul in the night by a vision,

block.text: Bir gecә Rәbb görüntüdә Paula dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be afraid, but speak and don't be silent;

block.text: <<Qorxma, danış, susma.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I am with you, and no one will attack you to harm you, for I have many people in this city.”

block.text: Bax Mәn sәninlәyәm, heç kimin sәnә pisliyi dәymәyәcәk, çünki bu şәhәrdә xalqım çoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lived there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.

block.text: Paul orada il yarım qaldı vә xalqa dayanmadan Allahın kәlamını öyrәtdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,
saying,

block.text: Axayya valisi Qalliyo olan zaman Yәhudilәr birlәşәrәk Paula hücum etdilәr vә onu valinin hökm kürsüsü qarşısına çıxartdılar.
Belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”

block.text: <<Bu adam Allaha qeyri-qanuni şәkildә ibadәt etmәk üçün insanları tovlayır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews,

block.text: Paul danışmaq istәyirdi ki, Qalliyo Yәhudilәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked crime, you Jews, it would be reasonable that I should bear with you;

block.text: <<Ey Yәhudilәr, әgәr ittihamınız bir haqsızlıq vә yaxud ağır cinayәt işinә görә olsaydı, sizi sәbirlә dinlәmәyi mәslәhәt bilәrdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves. For I don't want to be a judge of these matters.”

block.text: Amma mәsәlәlәr bir tәlimlә, bәzi adlarla vә sizin qanununuzla bağlı olduğu üçün bu işi özünüz hәll edin. Mәn belә şeylәrә hakimlik etmәk istәmirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He drove them from the judgment seat.

block.text: Belәliklә, onları hökm kürsüsündәn qovdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then all the Greeks laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. Gallio didn't care about any of these things.

block.text: Hamı sinaqoq rәisi Sosteni tutub hökm kürsüsünün qarşısında döydü. Qalliyo isә bu hadisәlәrә әhәmiyyәt vermәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul, having stayed after this many more days, took his leave of the brothers, and sailed from there for Syria, together with Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head in Cenchreae, for he had a vow.

block.text: Paul Korinfdә olan imanlı bacı-qardaşların yanında xeyli gün qaldı vә sonra onlarla vidalaşıb Priskila vә Akila ilә birgә Suriyaya getmәk üçün yelkәn açdı. O, Kenxreya limanında saçını qırxdırmışdı, çünki bir әhd etmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Ephesus, and he left them there; but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews.

block.text: Onlar Efesә çatanda Priskila ilә Akiladan ayrılaraq sinaqoqa girdi vә Yәhudilәrlә mübahisә etmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;

block.text: Ondan xahiş edәndә ki burada daha bir müddәt qalsın, buna razı olmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but taking his leave of them, he said,

block.text: Amma onlarla vidalaşanda belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem, but I will return again to you if God wills,”

block.text: <<Allah qoysa, yenә yanınıza gәlәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: he set sail from Ephesus.

block.text: Sonra Efesdәn yelkәn açıb getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the assembly, and went down to Antioch.

block.text: Qeysәriyyәyә çatandan sonra Yerusәlimә gedәrәk imanlılar cәmiyyәtinә baş çәkdi vә sonra oradan Antakyaya keçdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having spent some time there, he departed. He went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, establishing all the disciples in each place.

block.text: Bir müddәt orada qalandan sonra yola çıxdı. Qalatiya vә Frigiya bölgәlәrini gәzib dolaşaraq oradakı şagirdlәri ruhәn möhkәmlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus. He was well versed in the Scriptures.

block.text: Bu әrәfәlәrdә İsgәndәriyyәdә doğulmuş Apollo adlı bir Yәhudi Efesә gәldi. Onun yaxşı natiqliyi var idi vә Müqәddәs Yazıları çox yaxşı bilirdi,

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.

block.text: Rәbb yolunda da tәhsil almışdı. O, ruhda alışıb-yanaraq danışır vә yalnız Yәhyanın vәftizindәn xәbәri olduğu halda İsa ilә bağlı hәqiqәtlәri doğru öyrәdirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside, and explained to him the way of God more accurately.

block.text: O, sinaqoqda cәsarәtlә danışmağa başladı. Ona qulaq asan Priskila ilә Akila onu yanlarına çәkib Allah yolu barәdә daha dәqiq izahat verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had determined to pass over into Achaia, the brothers encouraged him, and wrote to the disciples to receive him. When he had come, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace;

block.text: Apollo Axayyaya getmәk istәyәndә bacı-qardaşlar onu hәvәslәndirdi vә oradakı şagirdlәrә mәktub yazdı ki, onu yaxşı qarşılasınlar. Apollo oraya çatanda Allahın lütfü ilә iman edәnlәrә çox kömәk etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for he powerfully refuted the Jews, publicly showing by the Scriptures that Jesus was the Christ.

block.text: Belә ki Müqәddәs Yazılarla İsanın Mәsih olduğunu sübuta yetirәrәk Yәhudilәrin iddialarını açıq şәkildә vә güclü surәtdә inkar edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 19
It happened that, while Apollos was at Corinth, Paul, having passed through the upper country, came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples.
He said to them,

block.text: Apollo Korinfdә olarkәn Paul daxili bölgәlәrdәn keçәrәk Efesә gәldi vә orada bir neçә şagirdlә rastlaşdı.
Onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?”

block.text: <<İman etdiyiniz zaman Müqәddәs Ruhu aldınızmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No, we haven't even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”

block.text: <<Müqәddәs Ruhun mövcudluğundan belә, xәbәrimiz yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Paul onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Into what then were you baptized?”

block.text: <<Elә isә nәyә әsasәn vәftiz oldunuz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Into John's baptism.”

block.text: <<Yәhyanın vәftizinә әsasәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John indeed baptized with the baptism of repentance. He told the people that they should believe in the one who would come after him, that is, in Jesus.”

block.text: <<Yәhyanın etdiyi vәftiz tövbә ilә bağlı bir vәftiz idi. Xalqı özündәn sonra Gәlәnә, yәni İsaya iman etmәyә çağırdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

block.text: Onlar bunu eşidәn kimi Rәbb İsanın adı ilә vәftiz oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Paul had laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke with other languages and prophesied.

block.text: Paul әllәrini onların üzәrinә qoyanda Müqәddәs Ruh onların üzәrinә endi, başqa dillәrdә danışmağa vә peyğәmbәrlik etmәyә başladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were about twelve men in all.

block.text: Onlar tәxminәn on iki kişi idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the synagogue, and spoke boldly for a period of three months. He reasoned persuasively with them concerning the Kingdom of God.

block.text: Sinaqoqa daxil olan Paul cәsarәtlә danışmağa başladı. Üç ay әrzindә onlarla mübahisәlәr aparır vә Allahın Padşahlığı barәdә onları inandırırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude. Therefore he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

block.text: Bәzilәri inadkar olub inanmaq istәmir vә xalqın qarşısında İsa yolunu pislәmәyә başlayırdı. Buna görә Paul onlardan ayrılıb şagirdlәrini dә götürüb apardı. O, Tiranın mühazirә otağında hәr gün mübahisәlәr edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This continued for two years, so that all those who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.

block.text: Bu vәziyyәt iki il davam etdi. Nәhayәt, istәr Yәhudi, istәrsә dә Yunan – bütün Asiya vilayәti әhalisi Rәbbin kәlamını eşitdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: God worked special miracles by the hands of Paul.

block.text: Allah Paul vasitәsilә fövqәladә möcüzәlәr yaradırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even handkerchiefs or aprons were carried away from his body to the sick, and the evil spirits went out.

block.text: Belә ki Paulun bәdәninә toxunan dәsmallar vә belinә bağladığı önlüklәr belә, götürülüb xәstәlәrin üstünә qoyulanda insanların xәstәliklәri yox olur, şәr ruhlar çıxırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of the itinerant Jews, exorcists, took on themselves to invoke over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying,

block.text: Bәzi әtrafı gәzib-dolaşan Yәhudi cindarlar da şәr ruhlara әsir olanlara Rәbb İsanın adını çәkәrәk deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”

block.text: <<Paulun vәz etdiyi İsanın adı ilә sizә әmr edirәm!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did this.

block.text: Yәhudilәrin Skeva adlı başçı kahinin yeddi oğlu bu işlә mәşğul idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The evil spirit answered,

block.text: Bir dәfә şәr ruh onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus I know, and Paul I know, but who are you?”

block.text: <<İsanı tanıyıram, Paul haqqında da hәr şey bilirәm. Bәs siz kimsiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The man who had the evil spirit leaped on them, and overpowered them. He prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.

block.text: Daxilindә şәr ruh olan adam onların üstünә hücum çәkdi, hamısını tәpiyinin altına salaraq mәğlub etdi. Belә ki onlar o evdәn lüt-üryan vә yaralı halda qaçdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who lived at Ephesus. Fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.

block.text: Bu xәbәr Efesdә yaşayan bütün Yәhudilәrә vә Yunanlara çatdı. Hamısını bir vahimә bürüdü vә Rәbb İsanın adının nüfuzu böyüdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many also of those who had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds.

block.text: İman edәnlәrin çoxu gәlib öz әmәllәrini açıq etiraf edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many of those who practiced magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all. They counted their price, and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver.

block.text: Cadugәrliklә mәşğul olan bir dәstә insan da öz kitablarını yığıb hamının qarşısında yandırdı. Kitablarının qiymәti hesablananda mәlum oldu ki, әlli min gümüş pula bәrabәr idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the word of the Lord was growing and becoming mighty.

block.text: Belәliklә, Rәbbin kәlamı qüdrәtlә böyüyüb tәsirini artırırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after these things had ended, Paul determined in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying,

block.text: Bunlar baş verәndәn sonra Paul qәrara gәldi ki, Makedoniya vә Axayyadan keçәrәk Yerusәlimә getsin. O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”

block.text: <<Oraya gedәndәn sonra gәrәk Romanı da görәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having sent into Macedonia two of those who served him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.

block.text: Xidmәtçilәrindәn ikisini – Timoteylә Erastı Makedoniyaya göndәrәrәk özü bir az Asiya vilayәtindә qaldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: About that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way.

block.text: O әrәfәlәrdә İsa yolu ilә bağlı böyük bir qarışıqlıq yarandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought no little business to the craftsmen.

block.text: Dimitri adlı bir zәrgәr gümüşdәn ilahә Artemidanın ev sәcdәgahlarını düzәldirdi vә sәnәtkarlara çoxlu gәlir gәtirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He gathered together with the workmen of like occupation, and said,

block.text: O, sәnәtkarları vә bu cür işlә mәşğul olanları bir yerә toplayıb belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth.

block.text: <<Ay kişilәr, bilirsiniz ki, gәlirimiz bu işdәn asılıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You see and hear, that not at Ephesus alone, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are no gods, that are made with hands.

block.text: Amma bu Paul “әl işi olan allahlar hәqiqi allahlar deyil” deyir. Yalnız Efesdә deyil, demәk olar ki, bütün Asiya vilayәtindә nә qәdәr insanı tovlayıb azdırdığını görmüsünüz vә eşitmisiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing. The goddess herself, who is worshipped throughout the province of Asia and the world will be robbed of her divine majesty.”

block.text: Onda böyük bir tәhlükә ilә üzlәşirik. Bu hәm bizim sәnәtimizin nüfuzunu itirә bilәr, hәm dә ulu ilahә Artemidanın mәbәdini gözdәn sala bilәr. Bununla da bütün Asiya vilayәtinin vә bütün dünyanın ibadәt etdiyi Artemidanın ululuğu heçә çıxar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard this they were filled with anger, and cried out, saying,

block.text: Oradakılar bunu eşidәndә bәrk hiddәtlәndi vә qışqıra-qışqıra dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

block.text: <<Efes ilahәsi Artemida uludur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The whole city was filled with confusion. They rushed with one accord into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel.

block.text: Şәhәr bir-birinә qarışdı. Xalq Paulun yol yoldaşları olan Makedoniyalı Qayla Aristarxı tutub sürüyәrәk birlikdә teatra doluşdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn't allow him.

block.text: Paul istәdi ki, xalqın arasına girsin, amma şagirdlәr onu buraxmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater.

block.text: Hәtta Paulun dostları olan Asiya vilayәtinin sәdrlәrinin bәzilәri dә ona xәbәr göndәrib yalvardı ki, teatra ayaq basmasın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion. Most of them didn't know why they had come together.

block.text: Teatrdakı yığıncaqda alәm qarışmışdı, hәr ağızdan bir avaz gәlirdi. Onların çoxu isә bilmirdi ki, buraya nә üçün gәlib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought Alexander out of the crowd, the Jews putting him forward. Alexander beckoned with his hand, and would have made a defense to the people.

block.text: Yәhudilәr İsgәndәri qarşıya çıxaranda izdihamın içәrisindәn bәzilәri hadisәni onunla әlaqәlәndirdi. O isә xalqın diqqәtini cәmlәşdirmәk üçün әlini qaldırdı vә onların qarşısında özünü müdafiә etmәk istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice for a time of about two hours cried out,

block.text: Amma xalq onun Yәhudi olduğunu bilәndә bir sәslә iki saata yaxın deyә qışqırışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

block.text: <<Efes ilahәsi Artemida uludur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the town clerk had quieted the crowd, he said,

block.text: İzdihamı sakitlәşdirәn şәhәrin icra mәmuru dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn't know that the city of the Ephesians is worshipper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?

block.text: <<Ey Efeslilәr, kim bilmir ki, Efes şәhәri ulu Artemida mәbәdinin vә göydәn gәlәn heykәlinin keşikçisidir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing then that these things can't be denied, you ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash.

block.text: Bunları heç kim inkar edә bilmәz. Buna görә sakit olmanız vә fikirlәşmәdәn bir iş görmәmәyiniz lazımdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you have brought these men here, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess.

block.text: Buraya gәtirdiyiniz adamlar nә mәbәdimizi soydu, nә dә ilahәmizi söydü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another.

block.text: Әgәr Dimitri vә onun sәnәtkar dostlarının kimdәn şikayәti varsa, mәhkәmәlәr açıqdır, valilәr dә var. Qoy bir-birlәrini orada ittiham etsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you seek anything about other matters, it will be settled in the regular assembly.

block.text: Sizin araşdıracağınız başqa hallar varsa, bunun da qanuni bir yığıncaqda hәll olması lazımdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For indeed we are in danger of being accused concerning this day's riot, there being no cause. Concerning it, we wouldn't be able to give an account of this commotion.”

block.text: Bugünkü hadisәlәrә görә üsyan qaldırdığımız üçün ittiham olunmaq tәhlükәsi qarşısındayıq. Bu sәbәbsiz iğtişaşa biz bәraәt qazandıra bilmәrik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

block.text: Bu sözlәri deyәrәk o, yığıncağı dağıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 20
After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples and encouraged them. Then he took leave of them and left to go into Macedonia.

block.text: Hay-küy sakitlәşәndәn sonra Paul şagirdlәri çağırıb ruhlandırdı. Sonra onlarla vidalaşaraq Makedoniyaya getmәk üçün yola çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had gone through those parts, and had encouraged them with many words, he came into Greece.

block.text: O tәrәflәri gәzib-dolaşaraq imanlılarla çoxlu söhbәtlәr aparıb onları ruhlandırandan sonra Yunanıstana getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spent three months there, and a plot was made against him by Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he determined to return through Macedonia.

block.text: Orada üç ay qaldı vә dәniz yolu ilә Suriyaya getmәk istәyirdi ki, ona qarşı Yәhudilәrin hazırladığı sui-qәsdә görә Makedoniya yolu ilә qayıtmaq qәrarına gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These accompanied him as far as Asia: Sopater of Beroea; Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians; Gaius of Derbe; Timothy; and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.

block.text: These accompanied him as far as Asia: Sopater of Beroea; Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians; Gaius of Derbe; Timothy; and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But these had gone ahead, and were waiting for us at Troas.

block.text: Bunlar bizdәn әvvәl gedib bizi Troasda gözlәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: We sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread, and came to them at Troas in five days, where we stayed seven days.

block.text: Biz dә Mayasız Çörәk bayramından sonra Filipidәn dәniz yolu ilә beş günә Troasa gәlәrәk onlarla görüşdük. Orada yeddi gün qaldıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the first day of the week, the disciples were gathered together to break bread. Paul talked with them, intending to depart on the next day, and continued his speech until midnight.

block.text: Hәftәnin ilk günündә çörәk bölmәk üçün bir yerә yığıldığımız zaman Paul camaatla söhbәt apardı. Ertәsi gün onlardan ayrılacaqdı, ona görә söhbәti gecә yarısına qәdәr davam etdirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were many lights in the upper room where we were gathered together.

block.text: Toplandığımız yuxarı mәrtәbәdәki otaqda çoxlu çıraqlar yanırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain young man named Eutychus sat in the window, weighed down with deep sleep. As Paul spoke still longer, being weighed down by his sleep, he fell down from the third story, and was taken up dead.

block.text: Eftik adlı bir yeniyetmә pәncәrәdә oturmuşdu. Paul söhbәti uzadanda Eftiki dәrin yuxu apardı. Yuxuya gedәn kimi o, üçüncü mәrtәbәdәn aşağı düşdü vә yerdәn onu qaldıranda o, ölü vәziyyәtindә idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul went down, and fell upon him, and embracing him said,

block.text: Paul aşağı enib yeniyetmәnin üstünә әyildi vә onu qucaqlayaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be troubled, for his life is in him.”

block.text: <<Narahat olmayın, indi canı sağdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had gone up, and had broken bread, and eaten, and had talked with them a long while, even until break of day, he departed.

block.text: Tәkrar yuxarı qalxıb çörәk böldü vә yemәk yedi. Gün doğana qәdәr onlarla uzun-uzadı söhbәt aparandan sonra oradan ayrıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the boy in alive, and were greatly comforted.

block.text: Oğlanı sağ-salamat apardılar vә bu hadisәdәn çox ruhlandılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we who went ahead to the ship set sail for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there. He had arranged this because he was going there on foot.

block.text: Biz irәli gedәrәk gәmiyә mindik vә Assosa tәrәf üzdük. Çünki Paulu oradan götürmәli idik. O, quru ilә getmәk istәdiyi üçün bunu belә nizamlamışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard, and came to Mitylene.

block.text: O bizi Assosda qarşılayanda onu gәmiyә mindirdik vә Mitiliniyә gәldik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sailing from there, we came the following day opposite Chios. The next day we touched at Samos and stayed at Trogyllium, and the day after we came to Miletus.

block.text: Oradan da dәnizdәn üzәrәk sәhәri gün Xios adasının qarşısına vә bir gündәn sonra isә Samosa çatdıq. Ertәsi gün Miletә gәldik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Paul had determined to sail past Ephesus, that he might not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hastening, if it were possible for him, to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.

block.text: Çünki Paul Asiya vilayәtindә vaxt itirmәmәk üçün Efesi ötüb keçmәk qәrarına gәlmişdi. O tәlәsirdi ki, imkan tapıb Әllinci Gün bayramında Yerusәlimdә olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to himself the elders of the assembly.

block.text: Paul Miletdәn Efesә xәbәr göndәrәrәk cәmiyyәt ağsaqqallarını yanına çağırtdırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come to him, he said to them,

block.text: Yanına gәlәndә onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, how I was with you all the time.

block.text: <<Asiya vilayәtinә qәdәm basdığım birinci gündәn bәri sizinlә olduğum dövrdәn bu vaxta qәdәr özümü necә apardığım sizә mәlumdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I served the Lord with all humility, with many tears, and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews;

block.text: Yәhudilәrin qәsd-qәrәzi vasitәsilә sınaqlardan keçәrkәn Rәbbә tam itaәtkarlıqla, göz yaşı içindә qulluq edirdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I didn't shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable. I taught you publically, from house to house.

block.text: Xeyirli olan hәr şeyi sizә bәyan edәrәk istәr açıq, istәrsә dә evdәn-evә gәzib-dolaşaraq tәlim vermәkdәn çәkinmәdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I testified both to Jews and to Greeks of repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.

block.text: Hәm Yәhudilәri, hәm dә Yunanları tövbә edib Allaha tәrәf dönmәyә vә Rәbbimiz İsaya iman gәtirmәyә çağırdım.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, behold, I go bound by the Spirit to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there;

block.text: İndi dә Ruhun tәkidi ilә Yerusәlimә gedirәm vә orada başıma nә gәlәcәyini bilmirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I only know that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me.

block.text: Lakin Müqәddәs Ruh hәr şәhәrdә xәbәrdarlıq edirdi ki, mәni zәncirlәr vә әziyyәtlәr gözlәyir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But these things don't count; nor do I hold my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to fully testify to the Good News of the grace of God.”

block.text: Öz canıma heç әhәmiyyәt vermirәm, onu qiymәtlәndirmirәm. Mәnә kifayәtdir ki, yolumu – Rәbb İsanın mәnә tapşırdığı kimi Allahın lütfünü göstәrәn Müjdәni şәhadәtetmә xidmәtini başa çatdırım.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now, behold, I know that you all, among whom I went about preaching the Kingdom of God, will see my face no more.

block.text: <<İndi aranızda dolaşıb Padşahlıq barәdә vәz etdiyim sizlәrdәn heç biriniz mәnim üzümü bir dә görmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I testify to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men.

block.text: Ona görә bu gün bunu sizә bәyan etmәk istәyirәm ki, mәn tәmizәm, heç kimin qanına bais olmamışam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I didn't shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.

block.text: Çünki mәn çәkinmәdәn Allahın bütün iradәsini sizә çatdırmışam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take heed, therefore, to yourselves, and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the assembly of the Lord and God which he purchased with his own blood.

block.text: Hәm özünüzә, hәm dә Müqәddәs Ruhun sizi nәzarәtçilәr tәyin etdiyi bütün sürüyә diqqәtlә baxın. Allahın Öz Oğlunun qanı bahasına әldә etdiyi bu cәmiyyәtini bәslәyin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I know that after my departure, vicious wolves will enter in among you, not sparing the flock.

block.text: Bilirәm ki, mәn gedәndәn sonra sürüyә rәhm etmәyәn yırtıcı canavarlar aranıza soxulacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Men will arise from among your own selves, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after them.

block.text: Aranızdan tәhrif edilmiş sözlәr deyәn, şagirdlәri özlәrinin ardınca çәkmәk istәyәn adamlar çıxacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore watch, remembering that for a period of three years I didn't cease to admonish everyone night and day with tears.

block.text: Buna görә oyaq dayanın. Üç il boyu, fasilәsiz, gecә-gündüz göz yaşı tökәrәk hәr birinizә necә nәsihәt verdiyimi yada salın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, brothers, I entrust you to God, and to the word of his grace. It is able to build you up, and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.

block.text: İndi isә mәn sizi Allaha vә Onun lütfü barәdәki kәlamına әmanәt edirәm. Bu kәlam sizi inkişaf etdirib tәqdis olunmuş bütün insanlar arasında irsә qovuşdurmağa qadirdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I coveted no one's silver, or gold, or clothing.

block.text: Mәn heç kimin nә qızılına, nә gümüşünә, nә dә pal-paltarına göz dikmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You yourselves know that these hands served my necessities, and those who were with me.

block.text: Siz dә bilirsiniz ki, bu әllәr hәm mәnim, hәm dә mәnimlә olanların ehtiyaclarını tәmin etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak. We must remember the words that the Lord Jesus said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’”

block.text: In all things I gave you an example, that so laboring you ought to help the weak. We must remember the words that the Lord Jesus said, 'It is more blessed to give than to receive.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.

block.text: Paul bu sözlәri söylәyәndәn sonra diz çöküb onlarla birlikdә dua etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all wept a lot, and fell on Paul's neck and kissed him.

block.text: Sonra hamısı ağlayaraq Paulun boynuna sarıldı vә onu öpdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were sad most of all because of the word which he had spoken, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.

block.text: Onlar әn çox <<mәnim üzümü bir dә görmәyәcәksiniz>> sözündәn kövrәldilәr. Sonra onu gәmiyә qәdәr yola saldılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 21
When it happened that we had parted from them and had set sail, we came with a straight course to Cos. The next day to we sailed to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.

block.text: Onlardan ayrılıb dәnizә çıxanda birbaşa Kosa getdik, sәhәri gün isә Rodosa, oradan da Pataraya keçdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

block.text: Finikiyaya gedәn bir gәmi tapdıq vә ona minib dәnizlә getdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come in sight of Cyprus, leaving it on the left hand, we sailed to Syria. We landed at Tyre, for there the ship was to unload her cargo.

block.text: Kipri gördük vә onun cәnubundan keçdik. Suriya istiqamәtinә getdik vә Sur şәhәrindә sahilә çıxdıq. Gәmi yükünü orada boşaltmalı idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found disciples, we stayed there seven days. These said to Paul through the Spirit, that he should not go up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Orada şagirdlәri axtarıb tapdıq vә yanlarında bir hәftә qaldıq. Şagirdlәr Ruhun tәsiri ilә Paula xәbәrdarlıq etdilәr ki, Yerusәlimә getmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it happened that we had accomplished the days, we departed and went on our journey. They all, with wives and children, brought us on our way until we were out of the city. Kneeling down on the beach, we prayed.

block.text: Amma oradakı günlәrimiz başa çatanda bu şәhәrdәn çıxıb yolumuza davam etdik. İmanlıların hamısı öz arvad-uşaqları ilә bәrabәr bizi şәhәrin kәnarına qәdәr ötürdü vә sahildә diz çökәrәk dua etdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

block.text: Bir-birimizlә vidalaşandan sonra biz gәmiyә mindik, onlar da evlәrinә qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had finished the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. We greeted the brothers, and stayed with them one day.

block.text: Surdan dәniz sәyahәtimizә davam edәrәk Ptolemaisә gәldik vә orada imanlı bacı-qardaşlara baş çәkib bir gün yanlarında qaldıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, we, who were Paul's companions, departed, and came to Caesarea. We entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.

block.text: Ertәsi gün onlardan ayrılıb Qeysәriyyәyә gәldik. Yeddi kömәkçidәn biri olan müjdәçi Filipin evinә gedib orada qaldıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.

block.text: Bu kişinin peyğәmbәrlik edәn dörd subay qızı var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As we stayed there some days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

block.text: Oraya çatandan bir neçә gün sonra Yәhudeyadan Aqab adlı bir peyğәmbәr gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to us, and taking Paul's belt, he bound his own feet and hands, and said,

block.text: O bizә yaxınlaşıb Paulun kәmәrini götürüb bununla öz әllәrini vә ayaqlarını bağlayaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Thus says the Holy Spirit: ‘So will the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”

block.text: <<Müqәddәs Ruh belә deyir: “Yәhudilәr bu kәmәrin sahibini Yerusәlimdә belә bağlayıb başqa millәtlәrә tәslim edәcәk”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we heard these things, both we and they of that place begged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
Then Paul answered,

block.text: Bu sözlәri eşidәndә hәm biz, hәm dә oranın sakinlәri Paula yalvardıq ki, Yerusәlimә getmәsin.
Buna cavab olaraq Paul belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”

block.text: <<Nә olub? Niyә ağlayaraq ürәyimi sızladırsınız? Mәn Rәbb İsanın adı uğrunda Yerusәlimdә tәkcә әl-ayağımın bağlanmasına deyil, ölümә dә hazıram>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying,

block.text: Paulu razı sala bilmәdikdә deyәrәk susduq:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord's will be done.”

block.text: <<Qoy Rәbbin iradәsi olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these days we took up our baggage and went up to Jerusalem.

block.text: Bir müddәt keçәndәn sonra biz hazırlıq işlәrini görüb Yerusәlimә tәrәf getdik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us. They brought Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we would stay.

block.text: Qeysәriyyәdә yaşayan şagirdlәrin bәzisi dә bizimlә birgә gәldi. Onlar bizi ilk şagirdlәrdәn biri olan Kiprli Minasonun evinә apardı, çünki biz onların evindә qalacaqdıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When we had come to Jerusalem, the brothers received us gladly.

block.text: Yerusәlimә çatanda imanlı bacı-qardaşlar bizi sevinclә qarşıladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The day following, Paul went in with us to James; and all the elders were present.

block.text: Ertәsi gün Paulla birlikdә Yaqubu görmәyә getdik. Cәmiyyәt ağsaqqallarının hamısı oraya yığılmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had greeted them, he reported one by one the things which God had worked among the Gentiles through his ministry.

block.text: Paul onlardan hal-әhval tutandan sonra öz xidmәti ilә әlaqәdar olaraq Allahın başqa millәtlәr arasında gördüyü işlәrdәn әtraflı mәlumat verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, when they heard it, glorified God. They said to him,

block.text: Bunları eşidәndә Allahı izzәtlәndirdilәr. Paula dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see, brother, how many thousands there are among the Jews of those who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law.

block.text: <<Görürsәnmi, qardaş, Yәhudilәr arasında on minlәrlә imanlı var vә hamısı Qanunun qeyrәtini çәkir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses. They tell them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.

block.text: They have been informed about you, that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses. They tell them not to circumcise their children neither to walk after the customs.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.

block.text: İndi nә edәk? Mütlәq sәnin bura gәldiyini eşidәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore do what we tell you. We have four men who have taken a vow.

block.text: Ona görә sәnә dediklәrimizә әmәl et. Bizim aramızda әhd edәn dörd kişi var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take them, and purify yourself with them, and pay their expenses for them, that they may shave their heads. Then all will know that there is no truth in the things that they have been informed about you, but that you yourself also walk keeping the law.

block.text: Bunları yanına al vә onlarla birgә paklanma mәrasiminә qoşul. Başlarını qırxdırmaq üçün qurban xәrclәrini sәn çәk. Bununla da hamı bilәcәk ki, sәnin haqqında eşitdiklәri әsassızdır, sәn dә Qanuna riayәt edirsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have sent a letter with our decision: They should abstain from what has been sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what has been strangled, and from sexual immorality.”

block.text: Başqa millәtlәrdәn olan imanlılara gәlincә, biz qәrara alıb onlara mәktub vasitәsilә yazmışıq ki, bütlәrә tәqdim olunan qurbanların әtini, boğularaq öldürülәn heyvanların әtini vә qan yemәsinlәr, hәmçinin özlәrini әxlaqsızlıqdan saxlasınlar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, purified himself. He went with them into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of purification, until the offering was offered for every one of them.

block.text: Bundan sonra Paul bu dörd kişini yanına alıb ertәsi gün onlarla bәrabәr özünü pak etdi. Sonra mәbәdә girәrәk paklanma dövrünün nә vaxt qurtaracağını, hәr birinin adına nә vaxt qurban tәqdim edilәcәyini elan etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the seven days were almost completed, the Jews from Asia, when they saw him in the temple, stirred up all the multitude and laid hands on him,
crying out,

block.text: Yeddi günlük müddәt qurtarmaq üzrә Asiya vilayәtindәn olan Yәhudilәr Paulu mәbәddә görәndә bütün izdihamı tәşvişә salaraq onu yaxaladılar
vә qışqırdılar:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Men of Israel, help us! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, and the law, and this place.

block.text: <<Ey İsraillilәr, kömәk edin! Hәr yerdә hәr kәsә xalqımıza, Qanuna vә bu Müqәddәs mәkana qarşı tәlim öyrәdәn adam budur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover, he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”

block.text: Hәmçinin mәbәdә bәzi Yunanları gәtirәrәk bu Müqәddәs mәkanı murdarladı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they had seen Trophimus, the Ephesian, with him in the city, and they supposed that Paul had brought him into the temple.

block.text: Bu Yәhudilәr Efesli Trofimi әvvәllәr şәhәrdә Paulun yanında gördüklәri üçün elә bilirdilәr ki, onu Paul mәbәdә gәtirib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the city was moved, and the people ran together. They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple. Immediately the doors were shut.

block.text: Bütün şәhәr oyandı. Camaat hәr tәrәfdәn qaçıb-gәlәrәk Paulu tutub mәbәddәn bayıra sürüdü. Dәrhal mәbәd qapıları bağlandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were trying to kill him, news came up to the commanding officer of the regiment that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.

block.text: Onlar Paulu öldürmәyә çalışırdı ki, bütün Yerusәlimin tәşvişә düşmәsi xәbәri Roma alayının minbaşısına çatdırıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. When they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

block.text: Minbaşı dәrhal yüzbaşılarla әsgәrlәri özü ilә götürәrәk izdiham olan yerә qaçdı. Minbaşı ilә әsgәrlәri görәn camaat Paulu döymәyi dayandırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains. He inquired who he was and what he had done.

block.text: O zaman minbaşı yaxına gәlib Paulu tutdu vә әmr etdi ki, onu qoşa zәncirlә bağlasınlar. Sonra soruşdu: <<Bu adam kimdir? Nә edib?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some shouted one thing, and some another, among the crowd. When he couldn't find out the truth because of the noise, he commanded him to be brought into the barracks.

block.text: İzdiham içindә hәr ağızdan bir avaz gәlir, qışqırışırdılar. Hay-küydәn minbaşı heç nә müәyyәnlәşdirә bilmәdi, ona görә Paulun qalaya aparılmasını әmr etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the stairs, it happened that he was carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd;

block.text: Paul pillәkәndә olanda xalq elә qızışmışdı ki, әsgәrlәr onu әllәri üstündә aparmalı oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for the multitude of the people followed after, crying out,

block.text: Çünki izdiham onun ardınca düşüb qışqırırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with him!”

block.text: <<Öldürün onu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer,

block.text: Paul qalaya gәtirilmәkdә ikәn o, minbaşıdan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I speak to you?”

block.text: <<Sәndәn bir söz soruşmaq olar?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Minbaşı dedi:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you know Greek?

block.text: <<Sәn Yunan dilini bilirsәn?

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren't you then the Egyptian, who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”

block.text: Sәn bu yaxınlarda iğtişaş yaratmağa başlayan dörd min qatili sәhraya aparan Misirli deyilsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Paul said,

block.text: Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.”

block.text: <<Mәn Yәhudiyәm, Kilikiyanın Tarsus şәhәrindәnәm, mәşhur bir şәhәrin vәtәndaşıyam. Rica edirәm, bu xalqa bir neçә söz demәyә izin ver>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had given him permission, Paul, standing on the stairs, beckoned with his hand to the people. When there was a great silence, he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, saying,

block.text: Minbaşı icazә verәndәn sonra Paul pillәkәnlәrin üstünә çıxıb diqqәti cәlb etmәk üçün xalqa әli ilә işarә etdi. Dәrin sükut çökәndә İbrani dilindә danışmağa başlayaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 22
“Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense which I now make to you.”

block.text: <<Qardaşlar vә atalar, indi mәnim özümü müdafiәmә qulaq asın!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they were even more quiet. He said,

block.text: Paulun onlarla ibranicә danışdığını eşidәndә daha dәrin sükut yarandı. Paul sözünә davam etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. At the feet of Gamaliel, I was instructed according to the strict tradition of the law of our fathers, being zealous for God, even as you all are this day.

block.text: <<Mәn bir Yәhudiyәm, Kilikiyanın Tarsus şәhәrindә doğuldum. Bu Yerusәlim şәhәrindә isә böyüyәrәk Qamlielin yanında ata-babalarımızın Qanununa bağlı ciddi bir tәlim almışam. Hamınızın bu gün etdiyi kimi mәn dә Allah naminә qeyrәt çәkirdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.

block.text: İsa yolunda olanları ölüncәyә qәdәr tәqib edәrdim vә qadın-kişi bilmәdәn onların әl-qolunu bağlayıb zindana salardım.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest and all the council of the elders testify. I even obtained letters from them to their brothers in Damascus, and I went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

block.text: Mәnim dediklәrim barәdә baş kahin vә bütün ağsaqqallar mәclisi dә şәhadәt edә bilәr. Hәtta mәn onlardan Dәmәşqdәki soydaşlarımıza yazılmış bir mәktub alaraq oradakı İsa yolunda olanların әl-qolunu bağlayıb cәzalandırmaq üçün Yerusәlimә gәtirmәyә gedirdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that, as I made my journey, and came close to Damascus, about noon, suddenly there shone from the sky a great light around me.

block.text: Mәn günortaya yaxın yolda, Dәmәşqә yaxınlaşmaqda ikәn birdәn-birә göydәn böyük bir işıq әtrafımda parladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’

block.text: Mәn yerә yıxıldım vә eşitdim ki, bir sәs mәnә belә deyir: “Şaul, Şaul, niyә Mәni tәqib edirsәn?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.’”

block.text: Mәn soruşdum: “Ey Ağam, Sәn kimsәn?” Sәs mәnә dedi: “Mәn sәnin tәqib etdiyin Nazaretli İsayam”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they didn't understand the voice of him who spoke to me.

block.text: <<Yanımdakılar işığı görsәlәr dә, mәnimlә danışanın sәsini eşitmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ The Lord said to me, ‘Arise, and go into Damascus. There you will be told about all things which are appointed for you to do.’

block.text: Mәn dedim: “Ya Rәbb, mәn nә edim?” Rәbb mәnә dedi: “Qalx, Dәmәşqә get, icra etmәyin üçün tәyin edilәn hәr şey orada sәnә deyilәcәk”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I couldn't see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.

block.text: O işığın parlaqlığından gözlәrim tutuldu. Yanımda olanlar әllәrimdәn tutub mәni Dәmәşqә apardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well reported of by all the Jews who lived in Damascus.

block.text: Orada Xananya adlı bir mömin kişi var idi. Bu adam Qanuna әmәl edir vә o şәhәrdә yaşayan Yәhudilәr arasında hörmәt sahibi idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to me, and standing by me said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight!’ In that very hour I looked up at him.

block.text: O mәnim yanıma gәlib dedi: “Qardaşım Şaul, qoy gözlәrin açılsın”. Dәrhal gözlәrim açıldı vә onu gördüm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One, and to hear a voice from his mouth.

block.text: O mәnә dedi: “Ata-babalarımızın Allahı sәni seçdi ki, Onun iradәsini bilәsәn vә Saleh Olanı görüb ağzından bir sәs eşidәsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.

block.text: Çünki görüb-eşitdiklәrini bütün insanlara yayaraq Onun üçün şәhadәt edәcәksәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now why do you wait? Arise, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’”

block.text: İndi nә gözlәyirsәn? Qalx, vәftiz ol vә Onun adını çağıraraq günahlarını yu”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened that, when I had returned to Jerusalem, and while I prayed in the temple, I fell into a trance,

block.text: <<Mәn Yerusәlimә qayıdıb mәbәddә dua etmәkdә idim ki, fikrimi bir görüntü apardı

ReferenceBlocks.text: I saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.’

block.text: vә Rәbbi gördüm. O mәnә dedi: “Tez ol, dәrhal Yerusәlimi tәrk et, çünki mәnim barәmdә etdiyin şәhadәti qәbul etmәyәcәklәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue those who believed in you.

block.text: Mәn dedim: “Ya Rәbb, bilirlәr ki, mәn sinaqoqdan-sinaqoqa gedәrәk Sәnә iman edәnlәri hәbs edir vә döyürdüm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blood of Stephen, your witness, was shed, I also was there too. I consented to his death and guarded the cloaks of those who killed him.’”

block.text: Hәtta Sәnin uğrunda şәhid olan Stefanın qanı tökülәndә mәn dә orada idim. Edilәnlәrә razı olub onu öldürәnlәrin üst geyimlәrini qoruyurdum”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you out far from here to the Gentiles.’”

block.text: Rәbb dә mәnә dedi: “Get, Mәn sәni uzaqlara, başqa millәtlәrin yanına göndәrәcәyәm”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They listened to him until he said that; then they lifted up their voice, and said,

block.text: Paula buraya qәdәr qulaq asanlar bu sözdәn sonra haray salıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rid the earth of this fellow, for he isn't fit to live!”

block.text: <<Belәsini yer üzündәn silib-atmaq lazımdır! O yaşamağa layiq deyil!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out, and threw off their cloaks, and threw dust into the air.

block.text: Onlar belә hay-küy qopararaq paltarlarını yellәyib havaya toz qaldıranda.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer commanded him to be brought into the barracks. He ordered him to be examined by scourging, that he might know for what crime they shouted against him.

block.text: Bu komandir də barak gətirilən üçün ona əmr. O, o, ona qarşı qışqırıb hansı cinayətə görə bilirik bilər ki, scourging tərəfindən yoxlanılmalı verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had tied him up with thongs, Paul asked the centurion who stood by,

block.text: Onu qamçılatmaq üçün bağlayanda Paul orada dayanan yüzbaşıya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and not found guilty?”

block.text: <<Mәhkum olmamış Roma vәtәndaşını qamçılatmağa icazәniz varmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion heard it, he went to the commanding officer and told him,

block.text: Yüzbaşı bunu eşidәn kimi minbaşının yanına gәlib xәbәr verәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch what you are about to do, for this man is a Roman!”

block.text: <<Nә edәcәksәn? Bu adam Roma vәtәndaşıdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer came and asked him,

block.text: Minbaşı Paulun yanına gәlib soruşdu:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me, are you a Roman?”

block.text: <<De görәk, sәn Roma vәtәndaşısan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes.”

block.text: <<Bәli>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The commanding officer answered,

block.text: Minbaşı cavabında dedi:

block.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: commander of Roman troops in Jerusalem
ReferenceBlocks.text: “I bought my citizenship for a great price.”

block.text: <<mәn nә qәdәr pula bu vәtәndaşlığı әldә etmişәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Paul isә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But I was born a Roman.”

block.text: <<amma mәn doğulandan Roma vәtәndaşıyam>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him. The commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.

block.text: Onu sorğuya çәkmәk istәyәnlәr dәrhal onun yanından geri çәkildi. Minbaşı qollarını bağladığı Paulun Roma vәtәndaşı olduğunu öyrәnәrkәn qorxdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But on the next day, He desired to know the truth about why he was accused by the Jews. So he freed him from the bonds, and commanded the chief priests and all the council to come together. Then he brought Paul down and set him before them.

block.text: Minbaşı ertәsi gün Yәhudilәrin Paulu nәdә ittiham etdiklәrini dәqiq öyrәnmәk istәdi. Ona görә Paulu azad etdi. Minbaşı әmr verdi ki, başçı kahinlәrlә bütün Ali Şura toplaşsın. Sonra Paulu aşağı endirib onların qarşısına gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ACTS CHP 23
Paul, looking steadfastly at the council, said,

block.text: Ali Şuranı diqqәtlә nәzәrdәn keçirәn Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Brothers, I have lived before God in all good conscience until this day.”

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, mәn bu günәcәn Allahın qarşısında tәmiz vicdanla yaşamışam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest, Ananias, commanded those who stood by him to
strike him on the mouth.
Then Paul said to him,

block.text: Baş kahin Xananya Paulun yanında duranlara әmr etdi ki,
onun ağzından vursunlar.
Bundan sonra Paul ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! Do you sit to judge me according to the law, and command me to be struck contrary to the law?”

block.text: <<Ey üzü ağardılan divar, sәni Allah vuracaq! Hәm oturub Qanuna әsasәn mәni mühakimә edirsәn, hәm dә Qanunu pozaraq mәni döymәk üçün әmr verirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who stood by said,

block.text: Yanında duranlar ona dedi:

block.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: those standing near Paul in Sanhedrin
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you malign God's high priest?”

block.text: <<Sәn Allahın baş kahinini söyürsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Paul said,

block.text: Paul dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I didn't know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”

block.text: <<Qardaşlar, onun baş kahin olduğunu bilmirdim. Әlbәttә, “xalqın başçısı barәdә pis söz demә” deyә yazılıb>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council,

block.text: Onların bir hissәsinin sadukey, digәr hissәsinin isә farisey olduğunu bilәn Paul Ali Şuraya nida etdi:
